غرفة طوارئ الفتيحاب بيان عاجل منذ ان دقت الحرب طبولها في 15 من ابريل و الشعب السوداني يتجرع مرارتها قتلا و نهبا و تشريدا و اغتصابا و تدميرا ، و ها نحن ندخل شهرها السابع و قد ازداد الوضع مأساوية في كل مناطق العمليات العسكرية في شتى بقاع السودان و في منطقة الفتيحاب على وجه التحديد . منطقة الفتيحاب الى الٱن مكتظة بالسكان و يتواجد بها ما يفوق الخمسين الفا من المواطنين كتقدير أولي ، لم تتوقف او تهدأ اصوات المعارك فيها اطلاقا حيث انها منطقه تماس بين مناطق سيطرة القوات المسلحه و مليشيا الدعم السريع ، مما اسفر تردي في مختلف جوانب الحياة المعيشية و الصحية و البيئية و زداد الوضع صعوبة نتيجة لفرض حصار من قبل مليشيا الدعم السريع منذ اكثر من 3 اشهر ، منعت فيه دخول المواد الغذائية و الطبية . ففي الجانب الصحي أغلقت اغلب المستشفيات و المراكز الصحية ابوابها ما عدا المستشفى و المراكز التي تشرف عليها غرفة الطوارئ ، إلا انها أصبحت تعاني من انعدام لأغلب الأدوية المنقذة للحياة و ادوية الأمراض المزمنة و ادوات الاسعافات الأولية و مواد المختبرات ، كما يعاني الكادر الطبي من الاجهاد و عدم حصوله على راتب لاكثر من 6 اشهر . أما في الجانب المعيشي فقد اغلقت كل الأسواق ما عدا سوق واحد (ام دفسو) ، و انعدمت كل السلع الضرورية كالزيت و الدقيق و السكر ، و اصبح الحصول عليها حلم بعيد المنال ، و اختفت الخضروات و اللحوم و الألبان و مشتقاتها . و في الجانب البيئي فقد وصل لمرحلة كارثية نسبة لتكدس النفايات المنزلية و الطبية ، كما كثرة البرك و المياة الراكده مما خلق بيئة مناسبة لتوالد الذباب و الباعوض و غيرها من نواقل الأمراض ، و كذلك بعض المقابر المستحدثة بسبب الحرب أصبحت قبورها مفتوحه نسبة لانتفاخ الجثث و نبش الكلاب. ايضا في جانب الخدمات فان المياه منعدمه منذ 5 اشهر نتيجة لتوقف محطة مياه المقرن ، و منع الحصار عربات المياه من الدخول (كارو) ، مما اجبر المواطن للشرب من مياة النيل الغير نقية مما تسبب في تفشي حالات الاسهالات المائية ، و فيما يخص الكهرباء فاكثر من 60% من منطقة الفتيحاب بلا كهرباء و 40% لديها تيار كهربائي غير مستقر و متذبذب . نتيجة لكل ما سبق أصبحت منطقة الفتيحاب منطقة منكوبة و اصبح شبح المجاعة قاب قوسين أو ادنى مما سيؤدي الى فجيعة انسانية و لينينغراد اخرى في القرن الواحد و العشرين و ستمثل وصمه عار على جبين الانسانية جمعاء. عليه نطلق نحن في غرفة طوارئ الفتيحاب نداء استغاثة و مناشدة انسانية عاجلة لكل المنظمات الدولية و الاقليمية للتدخل الفوري لإنقاذ مواطني الفتيحاب و تفادي هذه الكارثة الانسانية ، كما نطالب القوات المسلحة السودانية بضرورة فتح ممرات آمنة لدخول الأدوية و المواد الغذائية في اسرع وقت . 21 اكتوبر 2023 #انقذوا_الفتيحاب #الفتيحاب_تحتضر #فتح_ممرات_امنة ..................... Al-Fatehab Emergency Room Urgent statement Since the war began on April 15, the Sudanese people have endured the bitter consequences of violence, including killing, looting, displacement, rape, and destruction. Now, as we enter the seventh month of this war, the situation in various military operations areas across Sudan, and particularly in the Al-Fatehab area, has grown even more tragic. Al-Fatihab area is so far densely populated and has more than fifty thousand citizens as a preliminary estimate.. The sounds of battle have never ceased in this area, as it lies at the contact point between the regions controlled by the Army forces and the Rapid Support Militia. This ongoing conflict has taken a toll on various aspects of life and health, and the environmental conditions which have all worsened due to a blockade imposed by the Rapid Support Militia for more than three months restricting the entry of food and medical supplies. On the healthcare front, most hospitals and health centers have shut down, leaving only the hospital and centers supervised by the emergency room operational, however, these are now facing severe shortage of life-saving medications, chronic disease treatments, first-aid supplies, and laboratory materials. The medical staff is also under significant stress, having not received their salaries for over six months. In terms of living conditions, all markets except one (Um Dafso) have closed down. Essential commodities such as oil, flour, and sugar have ceased to exist and and obtaining them became an unattainable dream . Even basic food items like vegetables, meat, dairy, and their derivatives have vanished. On the environmental front, the situation has reached a catastrophic level due to the accumulation of household and medical waste. Ponds and stagnant water have become breeding grounds for flies, mosquitoes, and other disease-carrying vectors. Some cemeteries created as a result of the war have been exposed, with corpses swelling and dogs digging up graves. Regarding services, the Al-Muqrin water station has been offline for five months, and water trucks (Karo) are unable to enter due to a blockade. This has forced citizens to resort to drinking impure Nile water, resulting in an outbreak of watery diarrhea. As for electricity, over 60% of the Al-Fatihab area has no access to it, and the remaining 40% face unstable and fluctuating electrical supply. Due to the cumulative impact of these factors, Al-Fatihab area has become a disaster zone, with the looming threat of famine. This catastrophe could lead to a humanitarian crisis (truncated)

What is the Two State Solution? You hear it all the time, but what does it actually mean and why is it not as simple as it sounds. Here's the background: Prior to 1967, the area known as the Gaza Strip was administered Egypt, and the area known as the West Bank was effectively part of Jordan. In 1967, Egypt, Jordan, Syria, and Iraq fought a war with Israel which resulted in an Israeli victory. The war was the third in a series of wars fought by Arab States with the objective of completely removing the Israeli State. At the end of the War, Israel seized the Gaza Strip and the entire Sinai peninsula from Egypt, the West Bank (including East Jerusalem) from Jordan, and the Golan Heights from Syria. The Sinai peninsula was eventually given back to Egypt, however Egypt refused to take back the Gaza Strip. The Golan Heights and the West Bank have effectively remained under Israeli occupation ever since (Jordan eventually relinquished its claim to the West Bank in 1988). This means the West Bank has almost 2.8million Palestinians currently living under military occupation. When people talk about the "Two State Solution" they are pursuing the idea that the West Bank and Gaza Strip can become their own independent nation based on the borders before the war of 1967. This was the premise for the Oslo Accords and numerous peace plans ever since. So, what's the problem? There are two main obstacles. The first is the fact that Gaza is currently administered by a radical Islamist group who reject Israel's right to exist at all and, as we have seen recently, are unafraid to use terrorism to achieve their objectives. Hamas is a prescribed terrorist group in the US, UK, and Australia. Israel, understandably, don't see Hamas as someone they can negotiate with and don't want a State run by violent Jihadists, and funded by Iran, right next door. The West Bank, however, is administered by a more moderate group called Fatah who recognise Israel's right to exist and want a two state solution based on the 1967 border with East Jerusalem as its capital. Reasonable? Yes. But not that simple. In the 50 odd years since the 1967 war, half a million Israelis have built almost 200 settlements scattered around the West Bank, and a further 200,000 Israeli's now live in East Jerusalem. Many of these settlements were illegal even by Israeli law, but they are fuelled in no small part by a belief held by many settlers that they have a God given right to the land as Jews. A belief supported by successive right wing Israeli Governments (like Netanyahu). So here is the impossible equation facing any Israeli Government. Any genuine two state solution would require the forced removal of about 700,000 of their own citizens, the majority of whom would not leave their homes without a fight. To be blunt, it would be a brave Israeli President to run for Office on a platform of kicking hundreds or thousands of Israelis out of their home. At this point, it would be great for me to offer a solution... but there's a good reason why this conflict has been so protracted for so long, there are no simple solutions. But hopefully this post helps you understand just how difficult any path to peace will be. Merely calling for a Two State Solution without offering a workaround for these obstacles really doesn't move us forward. As with all things in this war, things are complicated, and rarely black and white.

Memorendum Submitted to H/CM N.Biren Singh by Scheduled Tribe Demand Committee of Manipur (STDCM) Twitter : https://x.com/stdcm_org:=:https://twitter.com/stdcm_org Website: https://stdcm.org:=:https://stdcm.org/ To, Shri N. Biren Singh, Hon'ble Chief Minister, Manipur. Imphal, the 6th October, 2023 Sub: In the matter of the demand for inclusion of the ethnic Meitei/Meetei Community, one of the Indigenous Communities of Manipur, in the Scheduled Tribes (ST) list under Article 342(1) of the Constitution of India. Hon'ble Sir, The present conflict in Manipur is now five months old with no immediate settlement in sight. The Scheduled Tribe Demand Committee of Manipur (STDCM) had refrained from raising the voice for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei community in the ST List during this period as it was felt that focus should be on bringing in normalcy in the State. STDCM had submitted a number of representations/memoranda on the matter highlighting the reasons for the demand for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei community in the ST List along with the rationale. But unfortunately, till now even after the passage of more than a decade since the demand was first raised, the State Government has not initiated any steps towards this end where recommendation of the State Government is mandatory. The State Government had to just examine the five criteria and if the Meitei/Meetei community fulfils the same, positive recommendation shall be submitted to the Centre. And, it is for the Centre to examine the matter and finally a Bill is to be placed before the Parliament and after passing the bill, necessary notification to the effect has to be issued. The STDCM, as mentioned earlier refrained from moving the agenda during the first five months of the present conflict so as to enable the State Government to focus on bringing in normalcy in the State. But even after the passage of five months normalcy is till elusive, which is not surprising as the matter is quite complex. However, the STDCM has been compelled to submit this reminder as it is felt that granting of ST status to the Meitei/Meetei community can be one of the crucial aspects for the resolution of the present conflict. The STDCM is ever ready to negotiate with other existing ST communities to address their apprehensions, if any. Further, if timely action is not taken immediately, the Meitei/Meetei community may become the only indigenous community in the entire North-East of the country which is not provided with such constitutional safeguards as may be guaranteed to its indigenous communities. Without such Constitutional safeguards they will not be able to compete and survive with their heads held high in this competitive world. Your honour may be aware that there is already a Bill pending before the Rajya Sabha, namely The Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order (Amendment) Bill 2019 wherein five communities of Assam i.e., Chutiya, Matak, Moran, Koch Rajbongshi and Tai Ahom along with its 36 other communities are proposed to be included in the ST List(Copy enclosed for kind reference). Since the Bill is pending (since 9th January, 2019) with Rajya Sabha it does not lapse and it will be only a question of time that the Bill is cleared by both Houses of the Parliament and becomes a law of the land. Tai Ahom who are much more advanced in many respects than the Meitei/Meetei. Once the Bill is passed, the Meitei/Meetei will be the only indigenous community in the entire North-East which is not delared as ST and our claim for indigeneity may even be challenged on its constitutionality. The present time is critical for the Meitei/Meetei tribe and if positive step to include it in the ST List is not taken up urgently, the fate of the Meitei/Meetei tribe will hang on a thin thread and its survival just cannot be ensured, despite the fact that it has a 2000 year old history. Those in the helm of affairs now will be judged by their action either as a villain who assisted in destroying the Meitei/Meetei tribe or a saviour who ensured that the tribe continues to survive with its glory. Therefore, the STDCM on behalf of the Meitei/Meetei tribe once again beseech you kindly to initiate urgent necessary action and furnish the required recommendations along with the essential documents to the Government of India for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei tribe in the Scheduled Tribe List under Article 342(1) of the Constitution of India so that the Bill regarding the Meitei/Meetei tribe can be placed before Parliament and discussed and passed along with the afore-mentioned pending Bill. We look forward to your kind positive action on this matter. Enclosed: As above Yours faithfully, 1. Dhiraj Yumnam President 2. K. Bhogendrajit Singh General Secretary #STDCM #Meitei #Meetie #ScheduledTribes #Manipur #MeiteiTribe #MeeteiTribe

FORTIFIED TOWN POČITELJ / 1926.year 𒁓 Počitelj, a mesmerizing fortified town in Bosnia and Herzegovina, has long been a source of fascination for scholars and adventurers alike, with its hidden secrets and intriguing history. **The Enigmatic Name** 𒋝 The story begins with the quest to decipher the very essence of "Počitelj." Its etymology remains a captivating puzzle, with multiple theories adding layers to the mystery. 𒋝 Some suggest its roots in the verb "počivati," an invitation to rest. Others propose that the town's castellan, a guardian of secrets, bestowed this name. 𒋝 A theory whispers that it harks back to a time when learned individuals "honored lords," giving rise to the name "Počitelj." 𒋝 In the tapestry of possibilities, one thread weaves it to the Italian word "cittadela," denoting a fortified town, while another connects it to the verb "čitati," beckoning us to read between the lines. 𒋝 The name of Počitelj remains a captivating secret, destined to continue its spell on both the public and scholars. **A Medieval Guardian** 𒋝 Venturing deeper into the tale, we encounter a medieval fortress nestled along the left bank of the Neretva River, near Čapljina. This fortress, like a steadfast sentinel, guarded the entrance to the lower Neretva valley, keeping watch over travelers along the path from Drijeva to Bišće. 𒋝 The earliest mention of Počitelj graced a 1444 charter, where it was known as "Posichell." In the annals of history, it reappeared in 1448 as "castrum Beczitel" and in 1454 as "civitate Pozitell cum pertinentiis suis." 𒋝 Yet, for a considerable stretch of time, a misconceived belief held sway. It was believed that Počitelj was the site of a Bosnian royal shipyard during the 14th century. However, the truth, like a buried treasure, lay elsewhere. 𒋝 The renowned coastal city founded by Tvrtko I. Kotromanić in 1383 was called Brštanik. This misunderstanding, akin to a phantom ship, linked shipbuilding to Počitelj due to its location. But the truth, much like the dawn dispelling the night, revealed that Brštanik was located farther away, severing the imaginary connection. 𒋝 Nevertheless, the pages of some literature continue to hold this erroneous belief. They claim that Tvrtko constructed Počitelj in 1383, a town shrouded in shipbuilding myths. **A Key Player in Ottoman Conflict** 𒋝 The history of Počitelj also tells the tale of its pivotal role in the conflict with the Ottomans. **A Modern Renaissance** 𒋝 In more recent times, this Herzegovinian town along the picturesque banks of the Neretva River experienced a renaissance, reminiscent of a phoenix rising from the ashes. From the latter half of the 16th century, it underwent substantial development. This transformation was a harmonious blend of architectural traditions, merging the oriental and Mediterranean influences. 𒋝 To this very day, Počitelj continues to preserve its architectural and cultural treasures. These include the Šišman Ibrahim-pasha mosque, the Počitelj clock tower, medrese, hamam, han (inn), and the Gavrankapetanović house. 𒋝 In January 2003, the historical urban area of Počitelj received the revered status of a national monument in Bosnia and Herzegovina. 𒋝 As the story unfolds, we find that in 2007, Počitelj's name was submitted as a candidate, a hopeful character, for UNESCO World Heritage recognition, a tale yet to be fully told. ▷ Welcome to Bosniaa and Herzegovina 🇧🇦 ◁ Experience the awe-inspiring splendor of Bosnia and Herzegovina, a nation renowned for its stunning natural landscapes, diverse cultural heritage, and fascinating history. 📝Author: Visit Bosnia and Herzegovina 📸 Photo : @visit.bosniaandherzegovina | ©️ © Copyright: Downloading of content is not allowed ! #bosniaandherzegovina #toptravelland ❤ #Eu 🇧🇦 #visit #bosnia #and #herzegovina #welcome #travel #trip #see #explorer #meet #discover #captivating #country #beautifu #destinations #natural #beauty #diverse #culture #richhistory #tourisme #TurizamBiH #USAID #USAIDTurizam 🇧🇦 #TheMostExcitingDestinationInTheWorld 🗺

1st Reading: Isaiah 45:1, 4–6

Thus says the Lord to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped, to subdue  nations before him and  to loose the belts of kings, to open doors before him that gates may not be closed: For the sake of my servant Jacob, and Israel my chosen, I call you by your name, I name you, though you do not know me. I am the Lord, and there is no other, besides me there is no God; I equip you, though you do not know me, that people may know, from the rising of the sun and from the west, that there is none besides me; I am the Lord, and there is no other.

Psalm 96:1 and 3, 4–5,7–8, 9–10a, and c 
Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

For the Lord is great and highly to be praised, to be feared above all gods. For the gods of the nations are naught. It was the Lord who made the heavens. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

Give the Lord, you families of peoples, give the Lord glory and power; give the Lord the glory of his name.   Bring an offering and enter his courts. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

2nd Reading: 1 Thessalonians 1:1–5b
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace. We give thanks to God always for all of you, constantly mentioning you in our prayers, remembering before our God and Father your work of faith and labour of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ. For we know, brothers loved by God, that he has chosen you, because our gospel came to you not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction.

Acclamation: You shine as lights in the world, holding fast to the word of life.

Gospel: Matthew 22:15–21
At that time: The Pharisees went and plotted how to entangle Jesus in his words. And they sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are true and teach the way of God truthfully, and you do not care about anyone’s opinion, for you are not swayed by appearances. Tell us, then, what you think. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?” But Jesus, aware of their malice, said, “Why put me to the test, you hypocrites? Show me the coin for the tax.” And they brought him a denarius. And Jesus said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?” They said, “Caesar’s.” Then he said to them, “Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
 
Reflection: Although the Pharisees are primarily a religious group, they are also political nationalists who resent paying taxes to the emperor and oppose all attempts by the Romans to interfere with the Jewish way of life. The Herodians, on the other hand, are a political group who support Herod Antipas and the Romans, and are open to making changes ordered by the Romans. These opposing camps, setting aside their ideological differences, conspire to discredit Jesus and if possible to eliminate Him, their common enemy. The different Christian communities today, divided on the basis of language, caste, race, beliefs and rites, can draw positive lessons from this. Since all Christians are united by the common thread of faith in Christ, they should strive, albeit their differences, to foster unity and cooperation among themselves because, as Pope Francis exhorts, “Unity is always higher than conflict.”

6CMOBN PARTICIPATES IN NATIONWIDE MULTI-SECTORAL PEACE ASSEMBLY FOR BARANGAY AND SANGGUNIANG KABATAAN ELECTIONS (BSKE) 2023. The 6CMOBn, CMOR, PA led by LTC DENNIS C ALMORATO MI (GSC) PA, the Commanding Officer, participated in the Nationwide Multi-Sectoral Peace Assembly for Barangay and Sangguniang Kabataan Elections (BSKE) 2023 held at Cotabato City Police Headquarters Ground, Cotabato City Police Office, PC Hill, RH-1, Cotabato City on October 16, 2023. The event was spearheaded by the Cotabato City Police Office headed by PCOL QUERUBIN L MANALANG JR, City Director, CCPO and supported by ATTY. NORPAISA A. PAGLALA-MANDUYOG, City Election Officer IV, COMELEC BARMM, as the Guest of Honor and Speaker; different local and national agencies, religious sectors, and various peace advocates and stakeholders. The activity aims to gather and gain support from the various stakeholders and different sectors of the society to discuss, understand and address common and emerging issues related to peace, security, development and order during the upcoming elections. It provides a platform for dialogue between government officials, law enforcement agencies, community leaders, and concerned citizens. The assembly seeks to promote a peaceful and fair electoral process by fostering understanding, collaboration, and cooperation among these groups. Through open discussions and exchanging ideas, participants can identify potential areas of conflict or tension that may arise during the election period and work together to find effective solutions. The assembly also aims to raise awareness for voters education, encouraging citizens to exercise their right to vote responsibly. A humanitarian catastrophe is unfolding in the midst of the conflict in Israel and Gaza, and once more health workers face dire challenges. Even before Tuesday’s massive explosion at the Al-Ahli Arab Hospital—which resulted in hundreds of deaths according to the Gaza Health Ministry—the World Health Organization last week described the health system in Gaza as “at a breaking point,” and reported: “Hospitals have only a few hours of electricity each day as they are forced to ration depleting fuel reserves and rely on generators to sustain the most critical functions. Even these functions will have to cease in a few days when fuel stocks are due to run out. The impact would be devastating for the most vulnerable patients, including the injured who need lifesaving surgery, patients in intensive care units, and newborns depending on care in incubators.” Marianne Szegedy-Maszak reached out to author Leonard Rubenstein for help in contextualizing what is happening in Gaza, with special attention to hospitals and health workers. What are the Rules of War? The rules of war are an internationally recognised set of guidelines that outline what parties at war can and can’t do. These are meant to protect people who are not involved in the conflict. Without the rules of war, organisations like MSF would not be able to respond to the urgent medical needs of people trapped in conflict zones, and many lives would be lost unnecessarily. When parties at war break these rules, thousands of innocent lives are lost, and suffering is exacerbated. For organisations like MSF, becoming a target means that we are unable to provide care for people who need it the most. For us, there is no greater crime than this.

Understanding the power of Love. One day my teacher told me of an incident that had happened in the monastery. An English woman, a friend of his, had arrived and was immediately angry with him, standing in front of him shouting and waving her arms. I was shocked to hear this, for in my mind I could not understand how anyone could be angry at this beautiful, smiling, brown skinned man, so I asked the question, “Bhante, what did you do?” “Oh,” he said, “I just waited for the anger to pass, then my friend was back.” This is the power of love. Without understanding, perhaps this story shows that when we are weak, we will accept the anger and abuse from others? With true understanding we will see that it is the absolute power of love that allows us to be in difficult situations in life and not take them personally and equally importantly, not be drawn into the madness of the world and react, like with like. When there is no wisdom and no love this is how the world manifests. Anger leading to more anger, fighting leading to more fighting, killing leading to more killing. Hatred is never overcome by more hatred. Only love overcomes hatred, This is an eternal law. Dhammapada: verse 5 It is only when we are out of balance that we allow ourselves to be abused and drawn into conflict. Choosing, taking sides, arguing who is right and who is wrong, always seeking blame and humiliation of the other. Love exists beyond this level of mind and is the only true and real balance in our life. It is love that will bring peace to ourselves and the world, but this practice of Loving Kindness (Metta Bhavana) is rarely fully understood. People have told me that their style of Loving Kindness is different from mine and that they take all the people that they don’t like and wrap them in pink fluffy clouds, “but you know,” they say, “they’re still as horrible as ever!” Here is the truth we must understand: We don’t practice Loving Kindness to change the other. We practice Loving Kindness so that we can be with the other - however they are! This is our strength, not to continually insist that the world and everything in it is always the way we think it should be so that we can be happy. Vipassana and Loving Kindness is a very mature way of life and living, it says ‘I accept you as you are and make no demands that you should be different so that I can be happy.’ Love is the real and beautiful power in our life. It is never weak and never subservient. It manifests in every moment as complete and unconditional acceptance of the universe exactly as it is in this moment. Things are like this, that is the reality of this moment, now, what is our place in this? With awareness we see, with love we accept, with wisdom we respond. This is the whole of Dhamma. May all beings be happy.

text: My 1st date with Star was almost the last. Why? Because I didn’t communicate. I liked her…a lot. But I didn’t tell her. I was almost silent. We both left the night frustrated. Me, because I didn’t “show up” and talk with her. And for Star, she thought it was a waste of time because she didn’t think I liked her. This wasn’t true, but she was forced to make an assumption based on my silence. Carline Leaf said, “What isn’t communicated is felt. What is felt is often interpreted. And what is interpreted is often inaccurate.” A great marriage needs mutual sacrificial love. But without effective communication, that love will be muted. The ceiling of your relationship is not determined by your level of love for each other but rather by your ability to connect, resolve conflict, and have fun together through communication. If you want a great marriage, become great at communication. . . . #communication #communicationtips #communicationskills #marriagerevolution #marriage

Dear Educators and School Owners, We are excited to introduce a valuable resource that can transform your school assembly into a powerful tool for shaping the character and behavior of your students - the Assembly Pep Talk book. This comprehensive compilation covers over 150 topics, each designed to instill morals, educate, inform, and instruct, making your morning assembly a beacon of inspiration and guidance. Here are compelling reasons for school owners to adopt this book as an integral part of their school assembly: Moral Development: In a world where values are often overlooked, the Assembly Pep Talk serves as a moral compass for students. It imparts essential life values, fostering empathy, respect, and responsibility. Educative Content: The book ensures that each assembly isn't just a routine gathering but an opportunity for learning. Students can expand their knowledge on diverse topics, enhancing their intellectual growth. Informative Lessons: It keeps students updated on current events and issues, making them more aware and informed citizens. This knowledge is empowering, helping them understand the world around them. Instructive Guidance: The Assembly Pep Talk offers practical guidance on various life skills, from time management to conflict resolution. This equips students with essential tools for personal and academic success. Positive Start to the Week: Using this resource sets a positive tone for the week. It motivates students to approach their studies and personal development with enthusiasm and purpose. Behavioral Improvement: By addressing character-building topics, the book helps in correcting and improving students' behavior. It can act as a preventive measure against issues like bullying and misconduct. "Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.” 1 Corinthians 15:58 There is no way around this fact that in this life we will have trials. We will have struggles but they are to grow us and to stretch our faith. So we step out in faith; and even then, we can have times of fear, doubt and anxiety. Many times we avoid conflict, hide from our struggles or simply try to escape pain through various ways. We can try and ignore our pressures but sooner or later avoidance won't work anymore. We have to face the situation we find ourselves in. The good news is that God is faithful. He knows our struggles, He knows our limitations. The Apostle Paul encourages us, because of the love and power of God, to stand firm and let nothing move us. So, my brothers and sisters in Christ, no matter what life throws at us, we must stand firm. We must not let anything move us. May it be personal problems, may it physical problems, financial problems or a myriad of other things. We are to trust God, and not be moved. We should let God handle our situation, and believe that He will always be there for us. And You cry out to Him and decide to Exercise your faith and give all your struggles, trials and temptations to Him and you feel your burden become lighter. You sense that God is giving you strength to live for Him. You affirm, "I will trust in God I will stand firm and let nothing move me and I will give myself fully to Your work!"

World leaders gathered in Cairo on Saturday and called for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and a massive increase in aid to Gaza. They also called for a definitive solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. That echoed a proposal for renewed talks on a two-state solution, put forward by the summit’s host, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi. With Israel preparing for a ground invasion, UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres told the summit, “We must act now to end the nightmare.” Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas said humanitarian corridors need to be opened to get aid to Gazans. More than a dozen countries sent top-level representatives, including Zhai Jun, China’s special envoy for Middle East issues. He went to the region to help ease tensions and promote peace talks. Israel did not attend. The United States did not send any senior officials. #IsraelHamasConflict #CairoPeaceSummit #MiddleEastCrisis #cgtnamerica

Passing by a massive table in the center of Tel Aviv, a multitude of different emotions washed over me. The table was set with more than 200 pieces of cutlery, ready for a meal, but it was surrounded by emptiness. This sight left a strong impression on me and my son. I told Daniel that this table symbolizes hope and anticipation. It's the anticipation of the return of loved ones who are held captive in Aza. Sitting at this table, I envisioned the conversations and family moments that could take place here if these people were with us. We approached the table and lit a candle as a sign of support. This gesture became our way to express solidarity with those waiting for the return of their loved ones and to hope for a swift end to the conflict.

"𝘌𝘲𝘶𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘵𝘩 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘴𝘬𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘴 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘢𝘷𝘢𝘪𝘭𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘣𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘶𝘭𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘨 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘮𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴." 𝗙𝘂𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗝𝗼𝗯𝘀 𝘉𝘺 𝘚𝘪𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘦 ‘𝘠𝘰𝘯𝘨’ 𝘈𝘧𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦, 𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘵𝘰𝘳 𝘪𝘯 𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘦𝘧 More and more companies in the United States are hiring workers without college degrees for jobs that previously required them. Tech giants like IBM, Accenture, Google, and major firms like Walmart and Bank of America are leading this shift. (https://tinyurl.com/4w7j6bv6:=:https://www.foxnews.com/media/us-companies-eliminate-college-degrees-requirement-school-costs) Is the same transformation underway here? The data is scarce. We know that high education costs have put degrees out of reach for many. There's a growing skills gap between what colleges teach and what employers need. Technology has also altered the landscape, with many skills better built through on-the-job training. As one expert said, you can get hired if you grasp the role, want it, and can do it - demonstrate the knowledge and zeal. This simple way spots potential better than parsing academic records. Myriad vital skills cannot be learned in school. Skills like bridging generational divides, maintaining mental health amid fraught relationships, and constantly upskilling as technology advances. Remote work has birthed communication and collaboration challenges. Increasing workplace diversity ratchets up the pressure to sustain productivity and harmony. Hybrid models complicate management. Conflict resolution is now daily fare, not part of sporadic crisis management. Our educational system, hobbled by politics and corruption, lacks coherent policy responses to this emerging landscape. Funneling more funds into minting college grads won't cut it. We shouldn’t feed the diploma mills. We may need to overhaul the entire apparatus. In the transition, the last things we need are ROTC and red-tagging. On all fronts, we must strip away curricular excess and sharply focus on writing, research, analysis, and critical thinking — the fundamentals of a robust mind. Concurrently, we must hone the real-world skills employers desire - technical chops, communication, teamwork, adaptability, and problem-solving. 𝘒𝘢𝘪𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘢𝘯 𝘴𝘢𝘣𝘢𝘺-𝘴𝘢𝘣𝘢𝘺. AI can accelerate learning curves. Online platforms are supplanting schools. Digital boot camps and technical certificates can secure jobs quicker than degrees. Practical, affordable alternatives to classroom learning abound. We must propagate a "vertical expertise, horizontal flexibility" model to catapult Filipino workers into the 21st century, degree or no degree. But we can't do this while squandering time revising historical facts in our textbooks. Policymakers must also ensure job stability, fair pay, and advancement for non-degreed workers. Regulations are needed to prevent exploitation and abuse. We must foster diverse, eclectic workplaces. As jobs morph rapidly, lifelong learning and adaptation will be crucial. We must retire healthy, not burnt out. Some may call this wishful thinking in a country wrestling with a 3 percent poverty learning rate and struggling to provide children with sufficient nutrients to survive. But alongside addressing those dire needs, we must transform our educational ecosystem for our nation's future. The path ahead will not be easy. Entrenched interests profit from preserving the status quo. Corrupt leaders want ignorant constituents. But we cannot let inertia forestall progress. Equipping youth with skills for available jobs and cultivating lifelong learning must become national priorities. With compassionate guidance, those without degrees can blossom into top performers. Given opportunities to prove themselves, they will repay trust manifold. An open mind is the raw material for success, not a diploma. This transition will require significant public and private investment in training programs. But the returns will be immense - a workforce with skills aligned to available jobs — a nation of strength and relevance in a competitive world. The path will be bumpy. But pioneering firms have illuminated the way forward. The winds of change can no longer be resisted.

THEIR LOVE LANGUAGE: WORDS OF AFFIRMATION When their love language is Words of Affirmation, it's crucial to understand what it is and isn't, debunk common misconceptions, and know how to navigate conflicts or stress: Love Language - Words of Affirmation: What it is: This love language involves expressing affection, appreciation, and love verbally. It includes compliments, "I love you," "Thank you," and encouraging words. What it's not: It's not about empty flattery or insincere praise. Words should be genuine and heartfelt, not just said for the sake of it. Common Misconceptions: It's Only About Compliments: Words of Affirmation go beyond compliments. It's about verbalizing love, gratitude, and emotional support. They're Needy: People with this love language aren't necessarily needy; they simply thrive on verbal expressions of love. It's their way of feeling loved and valued. During Conflict or Stress: Stay Calm: Maintain a calm and composed tone during conflicts. Reiterate your love for them and emphasize that the relationship matters. Active Listening: Listen attentively to their concerns. Reflect on what they say to show you understand their feelings. Positive Communication: Choose your words carefully. Avoid criticism and blame, and use "I" statements to express your feelings. Apologize Sincerely: If you're at fault, apologize genuinely. Acknowledge your mistakes and express your commitment to resolving the issue. Reassure and Support: During stress, offer words of comfort and support. Remind them that you're in this together and that your love is unwavering. In essence, with Words of Affirmation as their love language, verbal expressions are their emotional currency. Use words to show love, appreciation, and understanding. During conflicts, your caring words can help soothe tensions and reinforce your love and commitment to the relationship.

It’s been a very somber last week in parliament. It’s not just the suffering and dying in war zones that sickens and terrifies me, it’s what is born there. Seeds are sown for more conflict, more cruelty, more suffering, for generations to come. I felt this strongly when I visited the battlefields of World War 1. A lingering sense of evil - the only time in my life I’d use this word as a best description. Seems we never learn the lessons of history. If you are a 16 year old in #gaza you have now seen 6 wars in your short life. That’s desperately sad, and a warning to us all about how intractable this conflict has become. A conflict that could not only draw in other middle eastern powers (as has been the case 5 times over the past 65 years) but risks becoming global. The Greens are a party of peace and non violence, that’s one big reason I joined them. We condemn all violence, especially against civilians in wars. There has to be a better way forward to end the seemingly endless impasse of violence, occupation, suffering, war crimes - rather than the expected wholesale destruction of a city that has millions of occupants, 40% of them children. Binary ‘with us or against us’ political messaging is offensive and should be rejected, and makes more bloodshed inevitable, today and into the future. I’ll continue to share important updates from the @unitednations and other trusted information sources on this unfolding human catastrophe in and around Gaza, and what you can do. As much as it’s understandable- human nature to turn away when it all becomes too much for us to see, bear, we simply can’t. There is way too much at stake, we need to call for a ceasefire, humanitarian aid, and peace talks that offer hope for long term resolutions. #palestine #israel

Sidang Kemuncak ASEAN-GCC ini merupakan wadah bagi ASEAN dan enam (6) negara ahli GCC iaitu, Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Emiriah Arab Bersatu, dan Arab Saudi membincangkan kerjasama dan saling bertukar pandangan berkaitan isu berkepentingan bersama serta menyuarakan kebimbangan, terutamanya perkembangan terkini konflik Palestin-Israel. Dokumen hasil utama daripada Sidang Kemuncak ini adalah Kenyataan Bersama ASEAN-GCC dan Rangka Kerjasama (FOC) ASEAN-GCC bagi tahun 2024-2028. Saya telah mengiringi YAB Perdana Menteri, Dato' Seri Anwar Ibrahim yang telah menyampaikan Kenyataan Negara dengan menyuarakan kebimbangan Malaysia berkaitan konflik Palestin-Israel. Malaysia turut menyambut baik usaha kepimpinan GCC dalam menangani situasi di Gaza dan menyatakan peri penting kerjasama bersama GCC dalam menangani keperluan kemanusiaan yang mendesak termasuklah dalam mengurangkan kesengsaraan rakyat di Gaza. YAB PM turut menyatakan cabaran geopolitik masa kini memerlukan kerjasama erat dalam bidang ekonomi di antara ASEAN dan GCC dalam memastikan potensi ekonomi di antara dua rantau dapat dipenuhi. Malaysia menyatakan kesediaan bagi transformasi ini. Bagi memudahcara perkara ini, Malaysia mencadangkan pembentukan Perjanjian Kerjasama Ekonomi Menyeluruh ASEAN-GCC (ASEAN-GCC Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement - CEPA). Perjanjian penting ini dapat menggalakkan pembangunan yang progresif, inklusif dan mampan, terutamanya dalam rangka pemulihan pasca-COVID-19 dan ketidaktentuan geopolitik. Perjanjian CEPA ini merupakan Perjanjian Perdagangan Bebas pertama di antara ASEAN dan Timur Tengah. Malaysia, sebagai Negara Penyelaras bagi kerjasama ASEAN-GCC bagi tahun 2023 amat berbesar hati dapat menjadi sebahagian daripada persidangan bersejarah ini dan dapat memainkan peranan dalam memudahcara penganjuran Sidang Kemuncak pertama di antara ASEAN dan GCC. Terimq kasih juga kepada Arab Saudi yang menjadi tuan rumah persidangan kali ini. Sidang Kemuncak ini merupakan bukti bahawa terdapat banyak potensi yang wujud bagi kerjasama erat buat kedua-dua organisasi serantau ini. ------------------ The Summit provides a platform for ASEAN and the six (6) members of the GCC namely, Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, United Arab Emirates, and Saudi Arabia to discuss ways to substantiate their partnership and exchange views on matters of mutual interest and concern, with a particular emphasis on the developments in the Middle-East region with the ongoing conflict of Palestine-Israel. The key outcome of the Summit includes the Joint Statement of ASEAN-GCC and the ASEAN-GCC Framework of Cooperation (FOC) for 2024-2028. YAB PM in his statement expressed Malaysia’s grave concern on the ongoing crisis of Palestine-Israel. Malaysia commended the leadership of the GCC in addressing the situation in Gaza and also stressed the importance of collaboration with the GCC to address the urgent humanitarian needs and alleviate the suffering of the people in Gaza. YAB PM stated that the current geopolitical challenges compel a reimagining of economic cooperation between ASEAN and the GCC to harness the economic potential of both regions. Malaysia is dedicated to this transformation. To facilitate this, Malaysia proposes the creation of an ASEAN-GCC Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA). This agreement is deemed essential for promoting progressive, inclusive, and sustainable growth, particularly in the context of post-COVID-19 recovery and geopolitical uncertainties. Notably, this CEPA would be the first-ever Free Trade Agreement between ASEAN and the Middle East. Malaysia, as the Country Coordinator for ASEAN-GCC cooperation in 2023 is indeed honoured to be part of this historical event and having played a role in facilitating the convening of the first Summit between ASEAN and GCC. This Summit serves as tangible evidence of the extensive potential that exists for deeper cooperation between the two regional organisations. #wismaputra #doczam #MalaysiaMadani #ASEANGCC

👑 On this day - 21st October 1422 👑 . 👑 Death of Charles VI, the mad King of France 👑 . 👑 Any king who starts out as Charles the Beloved and ends up as Charles the Mad had something go seriously wrong along the way. Charles VI inherited one of the most powerful kingdoms in Europe, but as his mind grew more and more unhinged, his reign grew darker and darker, until he very nearly wiped France off the map.... 👑 Charles VI was born on 3rd December 1368, the son of King Charles V of the house of Valois, and his wife Joanna of Bourbon. His elder brothers died before he was born, so Charles was heir to the French throne, and held the title Dauphin of France. 👑 Charles ascended the throne at the young age of eleven, his father left behind a favorable military situation, marked by the reconquest of most of the English possessions in France. Charles had several uncles, powerful dukes, who were to rule in his stead, as his regents. Charles VI would rule France during a time of great chaos, and that turmoil existed within him as well. His reign was marked by the continuing conflict with the English, known as the Hundred years War. 👑 While Charles’s uncles were busy running France into the ground, Charles grew into a young man. By 17, he was fit, attractive, and athletic. Isabeau of Bavaria, was selected as his Bride. Isabeau was no fragile princess. She was quick-witted and intelligent, and she absorbed her lessons on the French court with ease. Pretty soon, she had all new clothes in the French style, she knew the ins and outs of French etiquette, and she was ready to meet her soon-to-be husband. 👑 Charles fell head over heels for Isabeau, the woman his advisors had selected for him was beautiful, young, and brilliant. From there, their romance was a whirlwind, he married Isabeau just three days after their first meeting. Though Isabeau of Bavaria would soon learn that the ring on her finger was more like an anchor, her marriage couldn't have gotten off to a better start. Charles was absolutely obsessed with her, and he lavished her with expensive gifts. They were a young couple in love, and they made the most of it—but it couldn't last forever. Though Charles's uncles still ruled France in his stead, he wasn't a boy any longer. 👑 It was time for Charles to take the reins and become the king he was meant to be—for better or for worse. When he was 21, he terminated the regency and took over the kingdom himself. Early in his reign, Charles's people dubbed him "Charles the Beloved" for getting rid of his greedy uncles and bringing stability back to France. After his early successes, those around Charles the beloved started to notice something was...changing about him. 👑 As the years went by, the people who had once called him Charles the Beloved started whispering another name: Charles the Mad. His mental illness came and went, so that you could never quite tell what kind of king you were going to get. His first bout of madness started in 1392, after assailants attacked his close friend and advisor, Olivier de Clisson. 👑 Charles started to grow paranoid, but no one expected just how twisted his mind would become. He constantly started suffering from fever and convulsions. Charles would live out the rest of his life plagued by insanity, and his kingly power was held by his influential uncles, and his wife Queen Isabeau of Bavaria. 👑 His paranoia and violent rages made him dangerous and homicidal to anyone in his close proximity. He infamously began running wildly through the hallways of his Parisian palace, in various states of dress/undress. At a certain point, his advisors had to wall up the entrances to the palace, lest the king run straight out into the streets. 👑 During one episode in 1393, he could not remember his name, and did not know he was king. When his wife came to visit, he asked his servants who she was and ordered them to take care of what she required, so that she would leave him alone. His spells of madness often meant Charles had to be restrained. 👑 Now, this was the Middle Ages, so it's not like everyone was walking around smelling like roses, but Charles took "lack of hygiene" to a whole new level. Once, he refused to bathe, or even change his clothes—for five whole months. The King of France was wearing soiled, disheveled robes, stinking to high heaven! So bad was his personal hygiene, it got to the point that he had to be cut out of his clothes. 👑 For the next three decades of Charles life, he would suffer similar mental breakdowns that would take him out of normality, for months at a time. Pretty soon, it began to take a toll on his wife. The first few years of Charles and Isabeau's relationship were mostly wonderful. They were madly in love, and they welcomed three children—though it wasn't all marital bliss. She lost two children in infancy, but at least she had her beloved husband to comfort her. However, as the madness began to creep in, Charles grew increasingly (truncated)

Won prestigious award🏆 - thanked his wife and joked about wedding nerves. #Jakob_Ingebrigtsen 🇳🇴 was honored🏆🥳 on Saturday evening for his exceptional season. The Sandnes boy set two world records💥💥, took WC gold🥇, WC silver🥈 and a double 💎Diamond League triumph🥇🥇. A year ago, the 23-year-old shared the award with Sweden's #Armand_Duplantis🇸🇪, but this season there was only one winner. In the Lithuanian🇱🇹 capital Vilnius, the Norwegian🇳🇴 was called up on stage, in favor of #Duplantis🇸🇪 and the Greek long jumper #Miltiadis_Tedoglou🇬🇷 - I'm in my own bubble and mostly focused on my own everyday life, and the competitions that take place on the athletics track, but to have an evening where you celebrate #European_Athletics and I'm awarded this prize, that's great, he says to NRK with award in hand. - It is well deserved, and as he also says, it is very nice to receive recognition for what you do. It is very large, praises his wife 💍Elisabeth. It didn't really come as a bombshell. Because there has been a hail of records from Ingebrigtsen in 2023: ✅ World record in 2000 meters ✅ World record for two English miles ✅ European record in 1500 meters ✅ European record for one English mile ✅ European record in 3000 meters ◾️He took European Championship gold🥇🥇 indoors in the 1500 meters and 3000 meters in March. ◾️It was silver🥈 in the 1500 meters and gold🥇 in the 5000 meters during the WC in Budapest. ◾️The season ended with a double win in the 💎Diamond League final. There he won both the 🥇English mile and the 🥇3000 meters in Eugene. During the award ceremony, he singled out the WC gold🥇 as the highlight🎊💫, and afterwards the star admitted that he is the type who quickly "forgets". - That's why things like this are nice to be "forced" to take part in, because I'm a bit like that, I move on to the next very quickly and put competitions and achievements behind me. Whether it's good or bad. From time to time it can be good to take a break and have fun with the people you travel with, says Ingebrigtsen. 🔶 Got questions about the wedding💍👰🏼‍♀️🤵🏻 On top of the medal and record sprinkling, he married #Elisabeth_Asserson in September. The jury hardly emphasized the marriage in the assessments, but Ingebrigtsen has stated several times how important she is to his career as a runner. ©️ When I and my fiancee were dating, we had gone a whole year without quarreling Yes! One whole year, without arguing... Just when I was thinking of proposing to her, a thought crossed my mind "We have never quarrelled before, are you sure we can cope with the conflict that comes with marriage?" I asked myself... Funny enough, I tried sparking up arguments whenever she visited, complained bitterly about anything she did but it didn't work She would either tell me "I'm sorry my love, you know I didn't mean to offend you" and smile that her irresistible smile and before I realise, I would be smiling myself... Or she would look at me with her baby face until I apologize. She never shouted back or spoke rudely...until one day, I made the mistake of asking her why she never picked a quarrel "You never shout or speak back at me, you're always too cool...I don't know if you will even be able to handle conflict in marriage sef..." I complained She looked at me, shocked and surprised at the same time... "So you want us to be quarreling?" She asked "No, but...you know, arguments bring better understanding in relationships" I explained bluntly "You think I don't understand you enough?" She asked, still calm By then I realised I was just being stupid...I kept mute "No problem, you've asked for it" she said Gbam. I started apologizing immediately but she gave deaf ears...a part of still wanted the drama to happen so I left her alone after pleading for some time I left for my room and waited for her to come and meet me but she stayed in the living room for almost an hour... Then she finally came to the room with a very strong face... "Come and eat" ...TBC... ©️ African Man

Ladies and gentlemen, We gather here today to address a topic that has plagued humanity for centuries: war. It's a subject that has brought pain, suffering, and division to countless communities around the world. But it's also a subject that we must actively work to change. We must collectively advocate for peace and strive to stop wars. War is a destructive force that tears at the very fabric of our society. It takes lives, destroys homes, and leaves behind a trail of heartache. It sows the seeds of hatred and revenge, perpetuating a cycle of violence that seems never-ending. However, the resolve to stop wars lies within our hands. First and foremost, we must acknowledge the power of diplomacy. History has shown us that peaceful negotiations, dialogue, and compromise can avert conflicts and bring about resolutions that benefit all parties involved. We must invest in diplomacy and engage in open, honest, and empathetic conversations with nations and people of different backgrounds. Secondly, we must address the root causes of conflict. Often, wars erupt due to a complex interplay of political, economic, and social factors. Poverty, inequality, and discrimination can create fertile ground for conflict. By working to alleviate these issues, we can reduce the likelihood of war. Moreover, education is a powerful tool in preventing wars. When we educate ourselves and our future generations about the horrors of war and the value of peace, we can foster a culture of tolerance, understanding, and compassion. It is our responsibility to teach the next generation that war is not the answer. In an age of increasing globalization, we must also recognize our interdependence. What happens in one part of the world can have far-reaching consequences elsewhere. Therefore, we must actively promote international cooperation and emphasize the importance of unity in the face of global challenges. Let us remember the wise words of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that." To stop wars, we must replace hatred with love, violence with peace, and division with unity. In conclusion, stopping wars is not an impossible dream. It is a noble pursuit that requires the dedication and collective effort of all nations and individuals. Together, we can create a world where conflict is resolved through dialogue, compassion, and understanding. Let us work tirelessly to make "peace" more than just a word, but a reality for all. Thank you.

Loch Leven Castle. Kinross. The earliest Castle to have been built on Castle Island Loch Leven is thought to date to about 1257 during the rein of Alexander III, at this point the castle would only have consisted of just the Curtain Wall, Parts of this early phase can still be seen. The castle has seen much action over its lifetime, It was taken by Edward I during the 1st Scottish Wars of Independence, and then latter during the same conflict, possibly by William Wallace before 1300. Edward I’s men initiated another siege but this time it was crushed by John (The Red) Comyn. After the death of King Robert Bruce the forces of Edward Balliol attempted to retake the Scottish Crown in the 2nd Scottish Wars of Independence, again Loch Leven Castle became a main target due to its location between Edinburgh, Perth and Stirling. During this siege Balliol’s forces attempted to flood the Castle by placing a dam over the Loch’s outlet, over the course of a month the water level rose, but a night raid by Scottish forces destroyed the dam and flooded Balliol’s camp instead. By the late 14th century the Tower House was added and is now one of the earliest substantially surviving Tower Houses in Scotland. Mary Queen of Scots was brought here after her defeat at the Battle of Carberry Hill 1567, Queen Mary was forced to submit to the opposing Lords rather than start a Civil War, she was also forced to Abdicate in favour of her 1 year old Son James VI. About a year into her imprisonment Mary managed to escape with the Help of George Douglas the Castle Keeper. Soon after these events a new house was built on the near by shore, this new build was appropriately called Newhouse, this became the main residence for the castle keepers and the old Castle began to loose its importance, by the end of the 16th century the Castle was falling into disrepair. It has been suggested that the loch here was originally called Loch Lomond as it is backed by the Lomond Hills and that Loch Lomond was once called Loch Leven as the River Leven flows from the south of Lomond through the Vale of Leven. #scotland #historicscotland #kinrossshire #lochlevencastle

James Webster Davidson (1895-1987), was born and raised in Gatehouse of Fleet. Living in Canada when war broke out in 1914, he returned to Gatehouse at the end of the conflict where he earned a living as a salmon fisherman (pictured). Like many young men of the time, Jim enjoyed writing verse and in 1920 he committed to paper a number of his poems, of which this is one: The Courtin’ Nicht When the courtin’ nicht comes roon yince mair It aye seems tae be my fate The boss comes in wi extra work He’s shair tae keep me late I git squared up, a’ things laid by Then aff I toddle hame The streets are like a skating rink When late, it’s aye the same I tried tae rin’ bit doon I went And nearly broke my leg Tae see mu mither’s ain wee hoose This nicht I wud be gled At last, I’ve made it, but my limbs Are feeling un’ca sair My mither greets me wi’ a smile Noo son, sit in yer chair Your soup’s dished oot, it’s boiling hot O’ aye, a’ thocht twad be, The very nicht I come hame late Yer catering no for me Sup that, twad tak’ an oor tae cuil Yer soup I winnae hae Just spreed a great big jeely piece And a glass o’ milk will dae And get me oot my Sunday claes My tartan breeks an’ a’ And toast my shirt afore the fire It’s time I was awa’ Oh dinnae get in such a stew I sometimes think yer daft When yer faither came a courtin’ me He was’na juist sae saft I’m getting strappit in my breeks When mither gies a laugh I’m struggling wi the braces noo Jings there’s a button aff The same thing happened yince before But my brain, alert, and keen In my pouch I always carry noo A great big safety peen I get my socks drawn ower my taes And there with-oot a doot A great big hole, it met my gaze And the big tae sticking oot There’s nae time noo, tae get it darned But I’m no sae easy bate I’ll fix it in a meenit Wi some adhesive tape Ach, I’m fed up, noo whaur’s my shoon Wi rushin’, like tae choke And shair enough I hear a crack Och, there’s the steeber broke Anither knot, that’s twa that’s in’t It broke yon nicht before I’ll buy a pair o’ slip-me ons On Setterday at the store Mither this collar’s far too stiff I canna get it on Noo there’s my tie it’s slippit oot I wish I’d ne’er been born At last I get it roon my kneck My tie a’ in a frump The coat draws on, I’m ready noo Then on the byke I jump A’ doon that street like lightening gaed As fast as ony train The only thing that passed me Was a great big aeroplane I’m skimming ower the slippy road Tae luck I had tae trust And then a shot it rent the air O’ heck the tyre’s burst And then on fitt I struggle on Nae chance o’ ony lift And pair wee Jean, I thocht o’ her She will be frozen stiff At last I reach the trysting place The dear auld rustic style Wee Jean, she hugs me roon the neck I see her winsome smile O’ Jean I’m sorry that I’m late Hae ye’ been waitin’ lang An’ then I tell the tale o’ woe Hoo’ everything went wrang O’ dinna worry Jimmy dear I tae got such a shock I’ve juist got here, I’m oot o’ breath The blinkin’ clock had stopped I took her in my airms yince mair The love-licht in her een I press her closer tae my hert My ain wee darlin’ Jean God blees the lassies ane an’ a’ As lang as life shall rin O’never rin the lassies doon But aye their praises sing Noo lads when rushed tae keep a date Don’t let worry git ye doon You’ll fin it only keeps ye late When the courtin’ nicht comes roon

#War- Archbishop of Goa and Daman on Friday appealed the Christians to pray and fast for peace between Israel and Palestine on October 27 In a communication released here, Fr Ferrao said that in a world marred by conflict and suffering, the ongoing strife in Israel and Palestine stands as a stark reminder of the urgent need for peace in our world. “We are witnessing a crisis that is claiming countless lives and causing immeasurable pain. Our Holy Father Francis is constantly voicing his concern for the humanitarian situation in Palestine and Israel, calling on all parties to lay down their weapons,” he said. The Archbishop noted that speaking at his General Audience on the October 18, Fr Francis said “Lay down weapons and heed the cries for peace from the poor, the people, and the innocent children. The Archbishop recalled that the Pope called on all Christians to pray and fast for peace on Friday, October 27, 2023. “He also encouraged people of other Christian denominations, other religions and all those who advocate for peace to participate as they see fit. The Pope announced that the central event on Friday would be an hour of prayer at 6 pm in St. Peter’s Square, with the goal of invoking peace for the world,” Fr Ferrao said. The Archbishop said that in response to our beloved Holy Father’s invitation, let us rise together and join him in observing coming Friday, the 27th of October, as a day of prayer, penance and fasting for peace in Israel and Palestine and between other war-torn countries and peoples. “Prayer and penance can play a vital role in this endeavour. While we encourage individuals and families to join in this global spiritual exercise, we urge our Parish Priests, Chaplains, Heads of Institutions and of Religious Communities to organize for the people under their care at least an hour of prayer for this intention,” Fr Ferrao said. #Goa #GoaNEws #Church #Christians #Palestine #Israel

There are large anti war protests going on in major Western cities. Some of the Pro Palestine ones in New York, London were huge. But still one fundumental question remains. Does public protest against wars in western cities ultimately matter? The answer is yes, protests matter. Anti-Vietnam war protests mattered. During the Iraq war in 2002, millions of people marched in Western Cities, including Washington DC. Europe saw some of the largest anti war protests in human history. It took about 12 years by when the entire political class in the West felt the pressure and openly started talking about the futility of that war. Biden today publicly asked Israel to not repeat the "mistakes" America made during those WOT era wars. He can publicly say that because Biden knows that's where the people's opinion is -- some of that credit goes to those laege protests. So yes, the Anti-Iraq protests also mattered. But anti war protests matter only "ultimately", not "immediately". So what's the forecast on Palestine? As the players in Western policy making circuits age, the continuation of the status-quo in Israel-Palestine will be unsustainable. The new generation of Jews, Christians, and the population in general see the Palestinian situation unjust and not worth continuation. An ever increasing Muslim population in Western democracies will make Pro Palestine activism politically more viable down the line. So the forecast is that there will be a time when the Palestinians will have more rights, determination and live a "better" live than what they got right now. And that will be possible because of political pressure from Western capitals -- thanks to the young voters of today who will be the policy makers in about 15-20 years time. US is probably about 3 to 4 election cycles away from electing an American President with dramatically different approach towards a conflict that will be around 80-90 years old by then.

After the Treaty of Montgomery in 1267, Llywelyn continued to prosper. One advantage was his new relationship with Edward, who had now completely given up on Wales. The heir to the English throne had switched his sights to the Holy Land, and devoted himself to raising an army for the crusade. At this stage, Edward was also concerned with undermining his rival Gilbert de Clare, Earl of Gloucester. Although the two had combined to destroy Simon de Montfort, they loathed each other and soon fell out again. Clare was also at loggerheads with Llywelyn, who wanted to extend the border of his new principality into Glamorgan. Since Clare held Glamorgan, conflict was inevitable. To get money for his crusade, and shaft Clare into the bargain, Edward allied with Llywelyn. In 1269 He persuaded his father, Henry III, to trigger a vital clause of the Montgomery agreement: this allowed Llywelyn to gain the homage of Maredudd ap Rhys Gryg, lord of Dinefwr, for a fee of 5000 marks. However, this could only happen if the king approved the sale. Maredudd himself had no wish to be Llywelyn's vassal, but he didn't have much choice. The sale was agreed, and Edward sent his clerk, Robert Burnell, to collect the money. It was never paid over: Llywelyn was not good with money, and the outstanding fee added to his growing mountain of debt. Even so, his relations with Edward remained cordial. In the summer the two met, for the second time, at the ford of Montgomery. Here, Edward made another concession and granted Llywelyn the homage of one Maredudd ap Gruffudd. This Maredudd was a lord of Glamorgan, and as such owed homage to Clare. Edward waved that aside and granted him to Llywelyn anyway. Anything to raise Clare's blood pressure. Llywelyn was pleased with the outcome of his meetings with Edward, as well he might be. Afterwards he sent a letter to the king, expressing his 'delight' at the talks. Sadly only a fragment of the letter survives; otherwise it might cast some very interesting light on his relationship with Edward at this time. Shortly afterwards Edward departed for the Holy Land, leaving Clare and Llywelyn to square up to each other.

I can help you survive and thrive during the holidays! https://www.britteast.com/guidance For some of us it happens every year around this time. We visit our families for the holidays, and they immediately start the old song and dance… *”When are you going to meet somebody?” 🤷‍♂️ *”Why are you still single?” 🤦‍♂️ *”When are you going to bring someone home?” 👨‍❤️‍👨 *”We want grand-kids!” 👶 It’s actually really sweet because they’re obviously trying. They just want to love and support us. But it can still feel like so much pressure. Some of us feel like we have to deflect, and change the topic entirely. Others of us actually lie, and tell them we’re dating someone, when we haven’t been on a real date in months, or even years. Can’t they see that of course we would love to meet someone special? That we long to start a family of our own? But maybe we just don’t have the slightest idea how to get started… ...and of course, if we do what we've always done, we'll likely get what we've always gotten. This year it's time to try something different: https://www.britteast.com/guidance Because it's time to come home to yourself. 🌈 And you don't have to do this alone anymore. ❤️

የምትለዋን አገላለጽ አሰብ አይገባንም ከሚል እሳቤ የመነጨ እንዳልሆነ ግን ከወዲሁ ልጠቁም። አሰብ በታሪክም ሆነ በአለም አቀፍ ሕግ የኢትዮጵያ የተፈጥሮ አንጡራ ሃብቷ ነው ብለው ከሚሞግቱና በጽኑ ከሚያምኑ ሰዎች መካከል ነኝ። ሻቢያና ህውሃት ከምዕራባዊያን ጋር ዶልተው ኢትዮጵያ ከአለም አቀፍ መስኮቶች (international windows) እንድትርቅ እና ወደብ አልባ እስረኛ አገር አድርገው የበደሏትን በደል ለማወቅ የፈለገ "the prisoner of geography" የሚለውን የTim Marshall መጽሐፍ ያንብብ። ለኢትዮጵያ የመቶ አመት የግጭት የቤት ሥራ የሰጧት መለስና ኢሳያስ ናቸው። በእነዚሁ ሁለት መሰሪ አንባገነኖች እስረኛ የተደረገችው ኢትዮጵያ ዛሬ ደግሞ እነሱ ጡጦ አጥብተተው ባሳደጓቸው ቅንጭር ካድሬዎች እየታመሰች ነው። እንግዲህ የመቶ አመቱ የቤት ስራ አካል መሆኑም አይደል። የዛሬው ትኩረቴ ከመልዕከተ ቅዳሜ ጽሑፎቼ በአንዱ ብልጽግና ወይም የዶ/ር አብይ አስተዳደር priority disorder ወይም የአጀንዳ ቅደም ተከተል መምታታት የገጠው የፖለቲካ ሃይል እንደሆነ በዝርዝር ከገለጽኩበት ጽሑፍ ጋር የተያያዘ ነው። በዚህ ጽሑፍ አገዛዙ የሚሄድበት የተሳሳተ አቅጣጫ እና ባህሪ እንዴት ኢትዮጵያ ከግጭት አዙሪት እንዳትወጣና መከራዋ እንዲበረታ እያደረገ መሆኑን በመጠኑ ለመግለጽ እሞክራለሁ። ይህን ስጽፍ በልበ ህሊናዮ በዚህ የተሳሳተ የፖለቲካ ምሪት የከፋ ግጭትና ትርምስ ውስጥ የገባችውን አገሬን፣ ትርጉም በሌላቸው ጦርነት ያለቁትን በመቶ ሺዎች የሚቆጠሩ ወገኖቼን፣ ከቀያቸው ተፈናቅለው በየመጠለያና በዱር የወደቁ ሚሊዮኖችን፣ በወሮበላ ታጣቂዎች የተደፈሩ ሕጻናትና ሴቶችን እያሰብኩ ነው። ጠቅላይ ሚንስትር አብይ የኢትዮጵያ ሕዝብ አንጀቱ ሲነፍርበትና ሲቆጭበት የኖረውን የቀይ ባሕር ጉዳይ በዚህ ወቅት ዋና አጀንዳ አድርገው፣ አይናቸውን በጨው አጥበው አገሪቱ በከፍተኛ የውስጥ ችግሮቿ፣ እርሃብ፣ ግጭትና የፖለቲካ አለመረጋጋት ውስጥ በገባችበት ወቅት ድንገት ሊያውም አወዛጋቢና ደንበር አቋራጭና ቀጠናዊ ግጭትን በሚጋብዝ መልኩ ይዘው ወደ አደባባይ የመጡበት ሁኔታ ስለ diversionary theory of war or conflict ያላቸውን መጠነኛ ግንዛቤ እንድታዘብ አድርጎኛል። Diversionary theory of conflict or war ብዙ ጊዜ የአገዛዝ ሥርዓቶች ሥልጣናቸውን አደጋ ላይ የሚጥል የውስጥ ግፊት ሲበረታባቸው ከአደጋው አምልጦም፣ ሥልጣንንም አስጠብቆ ለመዝለቅ የሚጠቀሙበት የፖለቲካ ሸር ነው። አንዳንዴ ተሳክቶ ያዋጣል። አንዳንድ ጊዜ ደግሞ ጭራሽ አደጋውን አባብሶ ከሥልጣን ይፈነቅላል። አንዳንድ ጥናቶች ላይ እንዲህ ይገልጹታል፣ leaders may use diversionary crisis or war under certain conditions when they are under the risk of losing office unconstitutionally. ለሁለት አመትት ትግራይ ላይ በተቀሰቀሰውና እየተስፋፋ አፋርና አማራ ክልሎችን አሽመድምዶ በብጫቂ ወረቀት ላይ በተደረገ የሰላም ስምምነት የተቋጨው ጦርነት ደጋግሜ እንዳልኩት ኢትዮጵያን ብዙ አሥርት አመታት ወደኋላ የመለሰ፣ ያራቆተ፣ ኢኮኖሚዋና ያደቀቀና ሕዝቧን ያዋረደና ለመከራ የሰጠ የቅርብ ክስተት ነው። የፕሪቶሪያ ስምምነት በውስጡ የያዛቸውን አደገኛ ድንጋጌዎች ለመተግበር አለም አቀፋዊና የውስጥ ጫና ውስጥ የወደቀው የአብይ አስተዳደር ይሄኔ ይመስለኛል የDiversionary crisisን እንደ መውጫ ብልሃት መጠቀም የጀመረው። ለዛም ይመስለኛል የሰላም ስምምነቱ የተፈረመበት ቀለም ሳይደርቅ የአገዛዙ አፈሙዝ ከትግራይ ወደ አማራ ክልል ያዞረው። ባጭሩ ይቋጫል ተብሎና ቀን ተበጅቶለት በተሳሳተ ግምት ከአማራ ልዩ ሃይልና ከፋኖ ጋር የተጀመረው ግጭት time horizon, diversionary crisis እና conflict initiation አንድ ላይ እንደ ስልት ተጣምረው መምጣታቸውን ማሳያ ነበር። የጊዜ ገደብ ተበጅቶለት፣ የምዕራቡ አለም በወንጀል የፈረጀውን የአማራ ታጣቂ ሃይልን ኢላማ ማድረግ ከዲፕሎማሲም ሆነ በሰሜኑ ግጭት ለተፈጸመው አለም አቀፍ ወንጀል ተጠያቂነትን ከራስ ላይ ለማራቅም ያለውን አዋጪነቱም በደንብ ተሰልቶ እና blaming the victims በሚመስል መንገድ ሃይልን Buffalo Bill Cody and Sitting Bull (Tȟatȟáŋka Íyotake). When people think of Buffalo Bill Cody, they often get caught up on two historical fallacies. The first is that Bill Cody was a horrific slaughterer of the American bison, otherwise known as the buffalo. The second is that his participation in the near-extermination event of the buffalo was driven by genocidal urges and federal dollars to deny Native American tribes their primary food source in hopes of eliminating them entirely. I see this interpretation of Cody's buffalo hunting days a lot, but I don't believe it is entirely accurate. William F. Cody hunted bison to feed the westward expansion of the railroad, but only for about 18 months. By the end of 1869, he worked full-time as a scout for the Army at Fort McPherson. During those 18 months, he earned a reputation as a great buffalo hunter, but he didn’t stand on a distant hill with a high-powered rifle and a looking glass, picking off docile creatures with no danger to himself. Bill Cody hunted the same way the Sioux, Cheyenne, and Pawnee did. He rode his horse towards a herd, separated the animal he would harvest, and ran alongside it until he could get the best shot possible. Cody killed a few animals at a time and brought them back to be used to feed the men working on expanding the railroad west. Despite what many think, he was never a hide hunter and never slaughtered buffalo indiscriminately for either the choice cuts (tongue and loin) or their hides. By 1873, when desperate economic times made hide hunting more attractive, Buffalo Bill and Texas Jack had left the prairies of Nebraska and the herds of buffalo that roamed it behind to become successful (and quite wealthy) actors. They would occasionally return west to hunt but were never again a significant factor in the decline of the bison. As part of his job as a scout, Buffalo Bill was involved with several altercations with Miniconjou, Lakota, Brule, Cheyenne, etc. Still, he never set out to murder Native Americans or to eliminate the bison, the staple of their diet, directly. That said, Bill Cody did kill multiple Native American men in conflict, and those incidents, especially his combat with and killing of Yellow Hair, were inflated and magnified in dime novels and on stage. He became a legendary "Indian fighter" more because of the legend than the reality. Cody, like the Native people he fought against, knew that when they went to war someone was going to kill and someone was going to be killed. Each man fought desperately to ensure that he was the former, and though they were enemies, each man held a measure of respect for his adversary. Likewise, Texas Jack was involved in conflicts with Sioux, Cheyenne, and Comanche warriors and developed a reputation as an "Indian fighter" despite having warm relations with the Pawnee tribe, joining them on their summer buffalo hunt in 1872, writing warmly about them in national publications, and being requested personally to join them by Pawnee head chief Pitaresaru (Chief of Men). Texas Jack also involved Cayuse native Donald McKay and his wife and daughter in his show well before Buffalo Bill ever brought Sioux into his Wild West shows. Whatever failing Cody exhibited in his younger life in regard to Native Americans must be contrasted with his later life. His inclusion of Lakota in his Wild West show, including Sitting Bull himself, allowed them to travel, but more importantly, to maintain and display their ceremonial dances and customs at a time when they were prevented by the United States government and Army from holding their religious ceremonies on the reservations. Cody paid the Native men and women in his show the same as he did the white cowboys, treated them fairly, kept families together, and was regarded as a warm friend by a great many of the Lakota that traveled with him. Over time, Buffalo Bill Cody became a stalwart advocate for Native peoples and their rights. In the same way, Cody’s inclusion of the bison in his Wild West shows made sure that spectators at the shows were endeared to the animals. Over time, they became a symbol of not just the Wild West, but of America writ large. Because the hundreds of thousands of people who saw the bison in Buffalo Bill’s Wild West now cared about the animals, they supported conservation movements that brought them back from the brink of extinction. The man who earned his name as a buffalo hunter became one of the primary forces in their survival. Cody publicly blamed most of the trouble between white men and Native tribes on the white men. He said that: "In nine cases out of ten where there is trouble between white men and Indians, it will be found that the white man is responsible Indians expect a man to keep his word. They can't understand how a man can lie." Dr. George Kingsley, who hunted with Cody and Omohundro, wrote that “[Buffalo Bill and Texas Jack] have a sympathy and a tenderness toward the Indians infinitely (truncated)
