Oct 22, Sun
1st Reading: Isaiah 45:1, 4–6

Thus says the Lord to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped, to subdue  nations before him and  to loose the belts of kings, to open doors before him that gates may not be closed: For the sake of my servant Jacob, and Israel my chosen, I call you by your name, I name you, though you do not know me. I am the Lord, and there is no other, besides me there is no God; I equip you, though you do not know me, that people may know, from the rising of the sun and from the west, that there is none besides me; I am the Lord, and there is no other.

Psalm 96:1 and 3, 4–5,7–8, 9–10a, and c 
Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

O sing a new song to the Lord; sing to the Lord, all the earth. Tell among the nations his glory, and his wonders among all the peoples. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

For the Lord is great and highly to be praised, to be feared above all gods. For the gods of the nations are naught. It was the Lord who made the heavens. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

Give the Lord, you families of peoples, give the Lord glory and power; give the Lord the glory of his name.   Bring an offering and enter his courts. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

Worship the Lord in holy splendour. O tremble before him, all the earth. Say to the nations, “The Lord is king.” he will judge the peoples in fairness. 

Response: Give the Lord glory and power.

2nd Reading: 1 Thessalonians 1:1–5b
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy To the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace. We give thanks to God always for all of you, constantly mentioning you in our prayers, remembering before our God and Father your work of faith and labour of love and steadfastness of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ. For we know, brothers loved by God, that he has chosen you, because our gospel came to you not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction.

Acclamation: You shine as lights in the world, holding fast to the word of life.

Gospel: Matthew 22:15–21
At that time: The Pharisees went and plotted how to entangle Jesus in his words. And they sent their disciples to him, along with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are true and teach the way of God truthfully, and you do not care about anyone’s opinion, for you are not swayed by appearances. Tell us, then, what you think. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?” But Jesus, aware of their malice, said, “Why put me to the test, you hypocrites? Show me the coin for the tax.” And they brought him a denarius. And Jesus said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?” They said, “Caesar’s.” Then he said to them, “Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.”
 
Reflection: Although the Pharisees are primarily a religious group, they are also political nationalists who resent paying taxes to the emperor and oppose all attempts by the Romans to interfere with the Jewish way of life. The Herodians, on the other hand, are a political group who support Herod Antipas and the Romans, and are open to making changes ordered by the Romans. These opposing camps, setting aside their ideological differences, conspire to discredit Jesus and if possible to eliminate Him, their common enemy. The different Christian communities today, divided on the basis of language, caste, race, beliefs and rites, can draw positive lessons from this. Since all Christians are united by the common thread of faith in Christ, they should strive, albeit their differences, to foster unity and cooperation among themselves because, as Pope Francis exhorts, “Unity is always higher than conflict.”

Moviment Graffitti activist Andre Callus said that not only are world leaders not doing anything about the devastation of Palestinian people but are “shaking hands with war criminals and pledging their support to keep exterminating Palestinians”. “You may think that from Malta there is not much we can do to help, but it is significant that people all over the world are gathering and saying that they recognise what is happening in Gaza as genocide,” Callus said. “When we speak to our children about this, we can tell them we were not complicit, unlike Roberta Metsola, who went to Israel to cheer them on.” Callus called on politicians to “change direction” when taking a stance on the conflict and remember that Palestinian civilians are being bombed non-stop while being deprived of food, water and electricity. Without a change in attitude, these deep wounds will not only fail to heal but will get worse, he said. “We will not forget the Palestinians, nor will allow the normalisation of Israel to keep doing as it pleases while those imprisoned on the corner of land they have left to be forgotten,” Callus continued. “It is a huge mistake and the world will not forget. Palestinians have been fighting for 75 years, not to take anyone’s land but simply to be allowed to exist.”

VOI LA CE NIVEL SUNTETI? CELE 17 NIVELE ALE CONSTIINTEI: NIVELURILE DISTRUCTIVE 1. Nivelul rusinii. La nivelul asta, esti dominat de nevroza. Esti timid, retras, introvertit. Devii paranoic, crezand ca toata lumea te judeca si incepi sa ai halucinatii. Cand ti-e rusine, incepi sa compensezi prin perfectionism, prin rigiditate, si incepi sa devii un extremist moral. 2. Nivelul vinovatiei. La nivelul asta, ori esti manipulat si pedepsit, ori pedepsesti manipuland. Cel mai mare lucru care te preocupa este pacatul, incepi sa actionezi din vinovatie si s-o proiectezi asupra altora. 3. Nivelul apatiei. La nivelul asta domina disperarea, lipsa sperantei. Viata pare fara rost, viitorul pare fara rost. Traiesti intr-o stare generala de neajutorare. Esti dependent de ceilalti iar altii te percep ca pe o povara de care trebuie sa aiba grija. 4. Nivelul doliului. La nivelul asta, traiesti predominant intr-o continua melancolie, fiind trist pentru ce ai pierdut. Incepi sa vezi tristete peste tot in jurul tau. Tristete pentru conditiile vietii, incepi sa privesti viata in sine ca fiind trista. Crezi ca nu poti inlocui ceea ce ai pierdut sau ce a simbolizat pentru tine. 5. Nivelul fricii. Aici, frica iti limiteaza cresterea ca persoana si duce la inhibitii. In acel moment, cauti lideri puternici care par ca si-au cucerit fricile si crezi ca ei vor fi cei care te vor scoate din culmile disperarii si te vor elibera din“sclavie”. 6. Nivelul dorintei. Cand esti in “dorinta”, lucrul asta te poate motiva sa participi intr-o gama larga de activitati “umane”. Insasi economia se afla la nivelul dorintei. Dorinta face sa investim efort, sa atingem obiective si sa obtinem premii. Insa dorinta este si nivelul dependentei: de alcool, de tutun, de droguri. Este nivelul acumularii si al lacomiei. De ce nu functioneaza? Pentru ca satisfacerea unei dorinte este inlocuita de alta dorinta, nesatisfacuta. La nivelul asta, ramai obsedat sa acumulezi din ce in ce mai multi bani, mai ales fara un scop final pentru ei. 7. Nivelul furiei. Dorinta duce la frustrare, iar frustrarea duce la furie. Aceasta poate duce, mai departe, la actiune distructiva sau la actiune constructiva. Furia te poate catapulta spre independenta sau te poate schimba in rau. Poate duce la ura si poate avea un efect coroziv in toate ariile vietii tale. 8. Nivelul mandriei. Nivelul la care ajungi in momentul in care ai autoritate in domeniul tau. Nivelul la care majoritatea vor sa ajunga. Mandria pare frumoasa, insa e frumoasa doar in comparatie cu nivelurile anterioare. In societate, mandria are o reputatie buna si e incurajata frecvent, insa e vulnerabila, deoarece e dependenta de conditiile exterioare. Daca acele conditii exterioare nu mai sunt implinite, te poate catapulta inapoi in cele mai de jos niveluri ale constiintei. Partile negative ale mandriei sunt aroganta si negarea lucrurilor care nu se incadreaza “in tipar”, blocand cresterea ta ca persoana. NIVELURILE CONSTRUCTIVE 9. Nivelul curajului. De-abia acum incepi sa devii cu adevarat puternic. Incepi sa explorezi si sa experimentezi lucruri noi, si devii stimulat de lucrurile pe care le faci. In “curaj”, ai energia sa inveti lucruri noi, iar cresterea si educatia nu mai sunt lucruri asa de mari pentru tine. In “curaj”,ai capacitatea de a-ti privi frica in ochi si de a creste, in pofida faptului ca ea inca exista acolo. 10. Nivelul neutralitatii. In momentul asta, incetezi sa mai privesti lucrurile in alb sau negru. Incepi sa nu mai fii rigid in lucrurile pe care le faci, devii flexibil si incetezi sa mai judeci in general. Cand lucrurile nu iti ies asa cum vrei, nu te mai simti infrant, nu te mai simti speriat, nu te mai simti frustrat. In“neutralitate”, poti sa spui cu usurinta “daca nu obtin lucrul asta, nu e nici o problema, o sa-l obtin pe altul”. E nivelul la care nu mai esti intimidat cu usurinta. Nu incerci sa demonstrezi nimic, nu esti interesat de conflict sau competitie, nu vrei sa controlezi comportamentul altor persoane.Incepi sa detii cu adevarat stabilitate emotionala. 11. Nivelul dispozitiei. Nivelul la care vei avea parte de cea mai rapida crestere. E nivelul la care ti-ai depasit problemele din viata ta si esti dispus sa participi la tot ce inseamna VIATA. De-abia acum devii cu adevarat prietenos, succesul aparand automat. Incepi sa lucrezi pe orice tip de post e nevoie, si nu te simti inferior atunci cand te ocupi de “munca de jos”. Incepi sa fii empatic la nevoile celorlalti, sa-i ajuti pe ceilalti si sa contribui la bunastarea societatii. 12. Nivelul acceptarii. In “acceptare”, incetezi sa mai obtii bucurie din lucrurile exterioare tie. Nimic din ceea ce exista in afara persoanei tale nu are capacitatea sa te faca cu adevarat fericit. Iubirea nu mai e oferita sau luata inapoi de catre altcineva, ci este generata din interior. Devii activ in viata, fara sa ai vreo intentie ascunsa. Nu mai esti interesat doar sa determini “ce e bine” si “ce e rau”, ci esti dedicat sa rezolvi (truncated)

بيان لوزير الخارجية بلينكن ترحب الولايات المتحدة بوصول قافلة مكونة من 20 شاحنة تحمل مساعدات إنسانية تشتد الحاجة إليها لسكان غزة، وهي الأولى منذ الهجوم الإرهابي المروع الذي شنته حماس على إسرائيل بتاريخ 7 تشرين الأول/أكتوبر. ونشكر شركاءنا في مصر وإسرائيل والأمم المتحدة على تسهيل المرور الآمن لهذه الشحنات عبر معبر رفح الحدودي. ويبدا المجتمع الدولي، بهذه القافلة، في معالجة الأزمة الإنسانية في غزة التي تركت سكان غزة دون الحصول على ما يكفي من الغذاء والماء وكذلك الرعاية الصحية والمأوى الآمن. وكان افتتاح طريق الإمداد الأساسي نتيجة لأيام من المشاركة الدبلوماسية الأمريكية الشاملة في المنطقة وكذلك التفاهم الذي توصل إليه الرئيس بايدن مع رئيس الوزراء الإسرائيلي بنيامين نتنياهو والرئيس المصري عبد الفتاح السيسي خلال زيارته التاريخية الأخيرة إلى إسرائيل. وعمل المبعوث الخاص ديفيد ساترفيلد، منذ تلك الزيارة، مع حكومتي إسرائيل ومصر وكذلك الأمم المتحدة للإشراف على تنفيذها. كما نحث جميع الأطراف على إبقاء معبر رفح مفتوحا لتمكين استمرار حركة المساعدات التي تعتبر ضرورية لرفاهية شعب غزة. وقد كنا واضحين: يجب على حماس ألا تتدخل في تقديم هذه المساعدات المنقذة للحياة. وإن المدنيين الفلسطينيين ليسوا مسؤولين عن الإرهاب المروع الذي تمارسه حماس، ولا ينبغي لهم أن يعانوا بسبب أعمالها المنحرفة. وكما قال الرئيس بايدن، إذا سرقت حماس هذه المساعدات أو حولتها، فإنها بذلك تثبت مرة أخرى أنها لا تهتم برفاهية الشعب الفلسطيني، ومن الناحية العملية فإنها ستعيق المجتمع الدولي من القدرة على تقديم هذه المساعدات. ويجب حماية أرواح المدنيين وكذلك يجب أن تصل المساعدات على نحو عاجل إلى المحتاجين. كما سنواصل العمل على نحو وثيق مع الشركاء في المنطقة للتأكيد على أهمية الالتزام بقانون الحرب، ودعم أولئك الذين يحاولون الوصول إلى بر الأمان أو تقديم المساعدات وكذلك تسهيل الحصول على الغذاء والماء وكذلك الرعاية الطبية والمأوى للمواطنين أينما كانوا في غزة. وإننا نواصل العمل على نحو عاجل مع مصر وإسرائيل لتسهيل قدرة المواطنين الأمريكيين وأفراد أسرهم المباشرين على الخروج من غزة بأمان ولسفر عبر مصر إلى وجهاتهم النهائية. ولا توجد أولوية أعلى من سلامة المواطنين الأمريكيين في الخارج وتستعد فرق السفارة الأمريكية بالقاهرة لمساعدة هؤلاء المواطنين الأمريكيين. كما إننا نعمل بلا كلل، بما في ذلك مع الدول الشريكة والحليفة التي لديها مواطنون في غزة، لضمان قدرتهم على مغادرة منطقة الصراع بأمان. https://eg.usembassy.gov/ar/humanitarian-assistance-for-gaza/ The United States welcomes the delivery of a 20-truck convoy carrying much needed humanitarian assistance to the people in Gaza, the first since Hamas’s horrific October 7 terrorist attack on Israel. We thank our partners in Egypt and Israel, and the United Nations, for facilitating the safe passage of these shipments through the Rafah border crossing. With this convoy, the international community is beginning to address the humanitarian crisis in Gaza that has left residents of Gaza without access to sufficient food, water, medical care, and safe shelter. The opening of this essential supply route was the result of days of exhaustive U.S. diplomatic engagement in the region and an understanding President Biden reached with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi during his recent historic visit to Israel. Since that visit, Special Envoy David Satterfield has worked with the governments of Israel and Egypt, as well as the United Nations, to oversee its implementation. We urge all parties to keep the Rafah crossing open to enable the continued movement of aid that is imperative to the welfare of the people of Gaza. We have been clear: Hamas must not interfere with the provision of this life-saving assistance. Palestinian civilians are not responsible for Hamas’s horrific terrorism, and they should not be made to suffer for its depraved acts. As President Biden stated, if Hamas steals or diverts this assistance it will have demonstrated once again that it has no regard for the welfare of the Palestinian people and as a practical matter it will hinder the international community from being able to provide this aid. Civilian lives must be protected, and assistance must urgently reach those in need. We will continue to work closely with partners in the region to stress the importance of adhering to the law of war, supporting those who are trying to get to safety or provide assistance, and facilitating access to food, water, medical care, and shelter for citizens wherever they are located in Gaza. We continue to work urgently in partnership with Egypt and Israel to facilitate the ability of U.S. citizens and their immediate family members to exit Gaza safely and travel via Egypt to their final destinations. There is no higher priority than the safety of U.S. citizens abroad, and U.S. Embassy Cairo teams are poised to assist these U.S. citizens. We are working tirelessly, including with partner and allied nations with citizens in Gaza, to secure their ability to safely depart the conflict area.

#StoryOfTheDay...Between #MichaelJackson "Another Great Team" and Rodney Jerkins marked a long collaboration. In an interview with VLAD TV, Rodney Jerkins spoke at length about Michael Jackson.

According to Rodney Jerkins, a demo of the song "If I Told You That" was made by his team as a duet between Whitney Houston and Michael Jackson using two similar voices.

For Jerkins, it seemed like the perfect time to bring together the two stars who had never worked together before.

However, MJ would have told Rodney Jerkins, "No, I don't want to do a duet right now.

So Clive Davis, producer and friend of Whitney's, who had already worked with George Michael, enlisted the latter for this duo.

Released in 1998 "If I Told You That" was on Whitney Houston's album "My Love is your Love". The song was then re-recorded for the best-of " Whitney: The Greatest Hits ", released in 2000, as a duet with George Michael.

Rodney Jerkins again recounted that his first work session with Michael Jackson took place in 1999 at the home of Carole Bayer Sager.

He confided that he was very intimidated when it was not in his nature, he who was used to controlling everything in the studio and who had already, despite his young age, worked with other singing stars. After 2-3 hours of composing, MJ asked him to stay and continue working on his new album.

Michael Jackson then arranged for Rodney Jerkins and his production team to work in Los Angeles.

According to Rodney Jerkins, working with Michael Jackson has allowed him to learn things he didn't know about the business, about music publishing, about the need to challenge himself to always do better musically and melodically.   

He explains that he developed a friendship with Michael Jackson  outside of the studio by inviting her to his home and also to his parents' house for lunch or dessert with a Michael Jackson who loved his mom's peach cobbler.

In another meeting, while work on the "Invincible" project was not quite finished, Michael Jackson had asked Rodney Jerkins if he was willing to sell his publishing rights to the material recorded for the album.

Finally, two days later, Michael Jackson called him and told him to forget the idea.

Rodney Jerkins recalls that at the time MJ did not just own the Beatles' song catalog, but half of the Sony/ATV catalog, which included many other stars of the song (Babyface, Mariah Carey, ...). MJ was a music publishing giant.

Concerning his studio work, the song "You Rock My Word" remains for Jerkins one of the favorite titles of his collaboration with Michael Jackson.

Even today, people still talk to him about it as a classic Michael Jackson, but Rodney Jerkins, lets a bit of bitterness show when he says that this title, like the others he collaborated on, could have had a greater career if Tommy Mottola and Sony hadn't been in conflict with Michael Jackson to the point of stopping the promotion very quickly.

He acknowledges that the sales of Invincible have nothing to do with Michael Jackson's previous albums but feels that with only one music video released for "You Rock My World", it is a far cry from the multiple music videos Michael Jackson used to release to promote his albums.

Rodney Jerkins explains that Michael Jackson had a vision for each of her albums. And when he worked with him, it was the same thing, MJ said "we're going to release that track first, then we're going to do a music video for 'Threatened'...".

Rodney Jerkins recalled that at the time, in 2001, Michael Jackson did not really have the opportunity to promote his album.

Despite all the disappointment of having seen the promotion around the album "Invincible" almost stopped after his first single, Jerkins keeps the satisfaction of having created a King of Pop classic with "You Rock My World".

He explains that Michael was different from all the other artists in the studio. He gave a lot of himself, he interpreted literally all his songs, to the point of being sweaty and having to change his shirts 3 times during the recording of "You Rock My World".

He gave so much energy in the recording booth.

Vocally, Jerkins places MJ in a Top 5 of the best singers, along with Marvin Gaye, Jackie Wilson, Sam Cook while acknowledging that he was the most unique/recognizable vocalist we've ever had.

According to Rodney Jerkins, nowadays, the times want us to believe someone when they say something happened, when in fact we don't know what happened because we weren't there.

He never saw anything inappropriate from DOJ, and he spent a lot of time with him.

Rodney Jerkins explains that he does not buy the false information spread by the propaganda and he believes that the accusers of "Leaving Neverland", should be ashamed, to use the cowardly process of accusing and bringing someone to justice after his death. 

In 2007, Rodney Jerkins confided that he had again collaborated with Michael Jackson by visiting Ireland. (At the time, MJ was working with (truncated)

Sometimes the line of what you will accept is very long, but when it's crossed you are done... game, set and match. To continue on with the emotional tug of war becomes counterproductive to your own healing and the best thing to do is call a truce, let it go and walk away. Often anger is not worth your time and energy. Tip your hat to the lesson learned, trigger worked through, incompatibility, growing apart or grace through change. This isn't a defeat, my friend. It's a choice of beliefs, values and where and in whom you choose to invest and engage your energy, your time, your emotions and your love. Let them have their learning space and you be in yours. Let the dice of distance roll and honor your ability to choose the direction of your life. This is your game to play or leave. Unfortunately what's "fair" is always subjective. Listen to your soul. Examine your heart. Do what feels right and let go of the drama, the conflict, the stress. Life is short. Live it on your best terms with integrity, honesty and heart. Jody Doty ©2023 Meditations and Musings by Jody Doty Image unknown

10 lessons from Meditations: A New Translation by Marcus Aurelius: 1. Accept what you cannot control. Aurelius believed that it is important to accept the things that we cannot control, such as the weather, the behavior of others, and our own mortality. He argued that by accepting these things, we can avoid suffering and achieve peace of mind. 2. Focus on the present moment. Aurelius believed that the present moment is all that we have, and that we should focus on it rather than dwelling on the past or worrying about the future. He argued that by focusing on the present moment, we can appreciate the good things in life and live more fully. 3. Be virtuous. Aurelius believed that it is important to live a virtuous life, which means living in accordance with reason and nature. He argued that by being virtuous, we can achieve happiness and fulfillment. 4. Be kind to others. Aurelius believed that we should be kind to others, even to those who wrong us. He argued that by being kind to others, we can make the world a better place and live more fulfilling lives. 5. Be humble. Aurelius believed that it is important to be humble and to recognize that we are all human beings with our own flaws and limitations. He argued that by being humble, we can avoid arrogance and learn from our mistakes. 6. Be grateful. Aurelius believed that it is important to be grateful for the good things in life, even the small things. He argued that by being grateful, we can appreciate what we have and live happier lives. 7. Don't be afraid of death. Aurelius believed that death is a natural part of life and that we should not be afraid of it. He argued that by accepting death, we can live our lives to the fullest and appreciate the time that we have. 8. Don't let your emotions control you. Aurelius believed that it is important to be in control of our emotions and not to let them control us. He argued that by controlling our emotions, we can avoid making impulsive decisions and live more rationally. 9. Don't judge others. Aurelius believed that we should not judge others, as we do not know their circumstances or their thoughts. He argued that by being non-judgmental, we can avoid conflict and build stronger relationships. 10. Don't worry about what others think of you. Aurelius believed that we should not worry about what others think of us, as we cannot control their thoughts. He argued that by focusing on our own actions and values, we can live more fulfilling lives. Meditations is a classic work of philosophy that has been inspiring readers for centuries. It is a book that can be read and reread, and each time you will find new insights and wisdom. Filipino youth activists staged a protest in front of the Commission on Human Rights in solidarity with Palestine's struggle for liberation today. The mobilization was led by the League of Filipino Students and other progressive youth groups. “There is no conflict between Israel and Palestine, only resistance from the Palestinian people against decades of attacks by the US-backed Israeli government,” said Lloyd Manango, League of Filipino Students vice chairperson. Israel’s continuous attacks and bombings in the Gaza Strip since October 7 have caused the deaths of 4,000 Palestinians, most of whom are women and children. In over two weeks, Israel has struck Gaza with 6,000 bombs after the militant group Hamas launched its offensive against Israel. The youth groups also staged a candle-lighting protest in condemnation of the killings waged by the Israeli government. Progressive groups also called on the Filipino youth to stand in solidarity with the people of Palestine. Photos by Luisa Elago and Kathleen Isaac #FreePalestine

REO Speedwagon's 1971 debut album was with their original lead singer, Terry Luttrell. Kevin Cronin took over that role for their next effort, R.E.O./T.W.O. (1972), but it was rough sledding, and while they were making their third album, Ridin' the Storm Out (1973), he left over conflict with guitarist Gary Richrath and other creative tensions. Cronin returned to the band in 1976, which meant moving from Chicago to Los Angeles, where they had relocated. On that trip, he had lots of time to think about all the changes in his life, and how he was (quite literally) rolling with them. The song hit him in a flash: he started writing the lyrics on a brown paper bag in his Ford Pinto while he was driving. Released as the first single from their 1978 album You Can Tune a Piano, but You Can't Tuna Fish, the song became their biggest hit to that point, reaching #58. The band made a music video for this song in 1978, three years before MTV went on the air. Directed by Arnold Levine, the black-and-white footage was shot at Kemper Arena in Kansas City, Missouri at their show on May 13, 1978. When MTV launched in 1981, they played the video, as REO Speedwagon were huge at the time, with a string of hits from their Hi Infidelity album.

The Most Great Peace In the midst of the serene wilderness, surrounded by towering ancient trees and a gentle breeze rustling through the leaves, Shunkmanu gathered his four beloved grandchildren – Oliver, Maya, Nahtayu, and Ella – for a special evening under the open sky. They sat in a circle around a crackling fire, the stars above them illuminating the night. Shunkmanu began to speak with the wisdom earned through decades of working with Indigenous peoples worldwide. "My dear grandchildren," he began, "tonight, I want to share with you a vision that many people of goodwill have held throughout the ages, a vision of something called 'The Most Great Peace.' It's a peace that countless seers, poets, and sacred teachings have spoken of for generations." As the flames danced in the fire, Shunkmanu continued, "The Most Great Peace, my grandchildren, is a dream of a world where all nations come together in harmony. It's a vision of a world where everyone can look at Mother Earth, with all its diverse peoples, and see it as one interconnected whole." Ella, the eldest grandchild, leaned in closer, her eyes filled with curiosity. "Is such a thing possible, Grandfather?" Shunkmanu smiled, his eyes reflecting the hope and determination of a lifetime. "Yes, Granddaughter, it is not only possible but inevitable. You see, we are at a unique moment in history. We can choose to continue down the path of conflict and suffering or embrace this vision of peace through consultation and cooperation." With her deep empathy for all living things, Maya nodded in agreement. "But, Grandfather, how do we make this peace a reality when there is so much discord and disagreement in the world?" Shunkmanu paused, gazing at the stars as if seeking guidance. "My dear Maya, it begins with each one of us, with our choices and actions. We must listen to one another, respect our differences, and work together to find common ground. The problems that confront nations can no longer be solved in isolation. We must come together as a world family, in harmony with our Mother Earth and all Life." Nahtayu, the thoughtful observer of the group, spoke up. "What if some people refuse to change their old ways?"’ Shunkmanu nodded knowingly. "Change is often met with resistance, but we must persist with patience and compassion. We must be the examples of the peace we seek, and over time, others will join us on this journey." Ella, the youngest and full of innocence, looked up at the stars and said, "I want to see this Most Great Peace, Grandfather. Can we make it happen?" Tears glistened in Shunkmanu's eyes as he hugged Ella tightly. "Yes, my dear Ella, we can. With the hellp and guidance of our Great Spirit we can do anything. We can plant the seeds of peace in our hearts and in the hearts of those around us. Remember, we are all interconnected, and our actions, no matter how small, can ripple out and create a world filled with the peace and harmony we envision." And so, under the vast canopy of stars, Shunkmanu shared his understanding about the coming of Peace on Earth with his beloved grandchildren, nurturing a dream that, like the fire that warmed them that night, would continue to burn brightly in their hearts for generations to come. As the night deepened, Shunkmanu continued to share his insights with his beloved grandchildren. "You see, my dear ones," he said, "world peace is not just a distant hope; it's an inevitability. It's the natural course of human evolution. Throughout history, we have faced many challenges, conflicts, and struggles, but we have also made incredible progress in understanding and connecting with one another." With a glimmer of hope in his eyes, Nahtayu asked, "But Grandfather, why do you believe that world peace is inevitable?" Shunkmanu leaned forward, his expression earnest. "It's because of the choices we have today that were never available to previous generations. We live in an age where communication and information flow freely across borders. We can see the beauty and diversity of our world, and we can also witness the consequences of our actions." Maya added, "So, it's like we're all becoming more aware of our interconnectedness." "Yes, exactly," Shunkmanu replied. "When people realize that we are all part of one world family, that our well-being is intertwined with the well-being of others, it becomes increasingly difficult to justify conflict and violence. This awareness is growing, and it's spreading across the world." Nahtayu chimed in, "But what about the challenges, Grandfather? There are still so many conflicts and injustices." Shunkmanu nodded in agreement. "Yes, there will be challenges along the way. Change is often met with resistance, and old patterns of behavior can be deeply ingrained. But the very fact that we are aware of these challenges and are discussing them means that progress is being made. We have the knowledge and the capacity to address these issues and move toward peace." (truncated)

The cast is led by Brandon Jovanovich in the challenging role of the protagonist, joined by Nicole Car as Ellen Orford. The production will be streamed live on LaScalaTv on 27 October. Did you know that 2 years ago UAE's foreign minister chastised much of the West for not taking a tougher stance on Hamas? At a time when Western media gobble up whatever Palestinians say, while BBC refuses to call Hamas a "terrorist" organisation, seeing an Arab country openly denounce it is not something you would necessarily expect. 🔴 But this world is so comically twisted that the most civilised Muslim countries in the the world are... the absolute monarchies of the Gulf :) In fact, in many ways they are better places to live than even the West is - particularly UAE, which has been open to foreign investment and migration for many years now, while for years one of the most isolated countries on Earth - Saudi Arabia - is following in its footsteps. 🔴 They are increasingly more developed, offer rising (sometimes very high - like Dubai or Abu Dhabi) living standards, suffer from little crime, have very low taxation and are thoroughly immune to the woke nonsense. But why would these Muslim Arabs speak so openly against Hamas? And, in fact, why have they turned away from Palestinians a long time ago, with Shia Iran being the main supporter of their cause these days? Because, unlike the bleeding-heart Westerners, they understand the subversive nature of organisations like Hamas as well as complete corruption of Palestinian leadership, which has now become manipulated by Iran to wage its holy war on Israel, that Arab rulers want nothing to do with (maybe except for Qatar). Hamas was spun-off from Muslim Brotherhood - the same organisation which has for decades tried to influence sociopolitical situation in the Muslim world, with the ultimate aim of a political takeover (e.g. in Egypt, where it briefly succeeded following the fall of Mubarak after the Arab Spring) and imposition of distinctly conservative, Islamic governance. This is why it tried to leverage the regional unrest of 2010s up and down the region, undermining i.a. the Gulf monarchies. 🔴 Emiratis and most of the other Arab rulers are very clear-eyed about it. While they are sympathetic towards creation of a Palestinian state, they also view Palestinians as pawns in Iranian hands, trying to destabilise the region. They must also view Palestinian leadership as utterly incapable of self-governance, offering dim prospects of a reasonable resolution of the conflict with Israel. And Israel is not a threat to Arab nations - Iran is. And, ironically, so are many pan-Islamic organisations. Why would they support reckless Palestinians when there's so much to be earned from cooperation with the Jews? Israel is not going away, after all, and it doesn't want to attack anybody either, so why fight it? Arab leaders understand that they have nothing to gain by participating in endless sectarian violence and that if their economies are to survive in the future without oil (or its diminished importance) they have to become an attractive part of the globalised world and not be perceived as backward, violent fundamentalists. They are so rational about it all because their self-preservation depends on it.

The Value of Each Other As much as the world around us tries to lure us into self-dependency, God created us for each other. For community. For a life that’s not alone. The author of Proverbs said it like this: “A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity.” Proverbs‬ ‭17:17‬ ‭NIV We’ll all face hard times—sometimes when we least expect it. But a friend’s genuine care can mean the world, a sibling’s unconditional love can’t be replaced, and a neighbor’s practical help is priceless. We need each other more than we realize: emotionally, practically, and spiritually. If you’ve found yourself in a busy season where you’ve unintentionally neglected your true friends or been too busy for your real family, now is the time to reprioritize. If there’s unresolved conflict with a friend or family member, and it’s slowly deteriorating the relationship, now is the time to set aside your pride and choose to make things right. If you’re silently struggling alone, now is the moment to let someone in. Give them a call, send them a text, or show up on their doorstep. If you can’t be honest and vulnerable, it will be difficult to get help. Not only do you need people, but those same people need you. You have strengths, gifts, talents, and a personality that’s unique to you and beneficial to them—and vice versa. Why bury them in the ground, in the name of autonomy, when they can benefit others? Sometimes we need to ask for help, and sometimes we need to be the help. Do you need help, or can you offer it? Could you use a hand, or do you have some time, money, advice, or expertise? If you’re tempted to self-isolate, don’t forget: we were meant to live life together.

Memorendum Submitted to H/CM N.Biren Singh by Scheduled Tribe Demand Committee of Manipur (STDCM) Twitter : https://x.com/stdcm_org:=:https://twitter.com/stdcm_org Website: https://stdcm.org:=:https://stdcm.org/ To, Shri N. Biren Singh, Hon'ble Chief Minister, Manipur. Imphal, the 6th October, 2023 Sub: In the matter of the demand for inclusion of the ethnic Meitei/Meetei Community, one of the Indigenous Communities of Manipur, in the Scheduled Tribes (ST) list under Article 342(1) of the Constitution of India. Hon'ble Sir, The present conflict in Manipur is now five months old with no immediate settlement in sight. The Scheduled Tribe Demand Committee of Manipur (STDCM) had refrained from raising the voice for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei community in the ST List during this period as it was felt that focus should be on bringing in normalcy in the State. STDCM had submitted a number of representations/memoranda on the matter highlighting the reasons for the demand for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei community in the ST List along with the rationale. But unfortunately, till now even after the passage of more than a decade since the demand was first raised, the State Government has not initiated any steps towards this end where recommendation of the State Government is mandatory. The State Government had to just examine the five criteria and if the Meitei/Meetei community fulfils the same, positive recommendation shall be submitted to the Centre. And, it is for the Centre to examine the matter and finally a Bill is to be placed before the Parliament and after passing the bill, necessary notification to the effect has to be issued. The STDCM, as mentioned earlier refrained from moving the agenda during the first five months of the present conflict so as to enable the State Government to focus on bringing in normalcy in the State. But even after the passage of five months normalcy is till elusive, which is not surprising as the matter is quite complex. However, the STDCM has been compelled to submit this reminder as it is felt that granting of ST status to the Meitei/Meetei community can be one of the crucial aspects for the resolution of the present conflict. The STDCM is ever ready to negotiate with other existing ST communities to address their apprehensions, if any. Further, if timely action is not taken immediately, the Meitei/Meetei community may become the only indigenous community in the entire North-East of the country which is not provided with such constitutional safeguards as may be guaranteed to its indigenous communities. Without such Constitutional safeguards they will not be able to compete and survive with their heads held high in this competitive world. Your honour may be aware that there is already a Bill pending before the Rajya Sabha, namely The Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) Order (Amendment) Bill 2019 wherein five communities of Assam i.e., Chutiya, Matak, Moran, Koch Rajbongshi and Tai Ahom along with its 36 other communities are proposed to be included in the ST List(Copy enclosed for kind reference). Since the Bill is pending (since 9th January, 2019) with Rajya Sabha it does not lapse and it will be only a question of time that the Bill is cleared by both Houses of the Parliament and becomes a law of the land. Tai Ahom who are much more advanced in many respects than the Meitei/Meetei. Once the Bill is passed, the Meitei/Meetei will be the only indigenous community in the entire North-East which is not delared as ST and our claim for indigeneity may even be challenged on its constitutionality. The present time is critical for the Meitei/Meetei tribe and if positive step to include it in the ST List is not taken up urgently, the fate of the Meitei/Meetei tribe will hang on a thin thread and its survival just cannot be ensured, despite the fact that it has a 2000 year old history. Those in the helm of affairs now will be judged by their action either as a villain who assisted in destroying the Meitei/Meetei tribe or a saviour who ensured that the tribe continues to survive with its glory. Therefore, the STDCM on behalf of the Meitei/Meetei tribe once again beseech you kindly to initiate urgent necessary action and furnish the required recommendations along with the essential documents to the Government of India for inclusion of the Meitei/Meetei tribe in the Scheduled Tribe List under Article 342(1) of the Constitution of India so that the Bill regarding the Meitei/Meetei tribe can be placed before Parliament and discussed and passed along with the afore-mentioned pending Bill. We look forward to your kind positive action on this matter. Enclosed: As above Yours faithfully, 1. Dhiraj Yumnam President 2. K. Bhogendrajit Singh General Secretary #STDCM #Meitei #Meetie #ScheduledTribes #Manipur #MeiteiTribe #MeeteiTribe

#Aravind #Dasa:
#ATMA #SAKSHATKAR #EXPERIENCE

Earlier I used to get carried away by my thoughts and worry. But nowadays I am aware that thoughts are simply flowing and I do not get disturbed or worried by them. 

Earlier it was like we are walking in darkness, hardly anything was visible, and there were worries about what might lay ahead. But now with the torch of awareness shining bright, things are quite clear.

I can let the thoughts be. I don’t try to control them anymore. 

I can see that worry or hurt are stories created by mind and I can be detached. I no longer react if someone treats me badly. I can see, feel and understand where the other person is coming from and accordingly respond. 

My mind no longer takes me to the past, even if I remember an otherwise hurtful incident that could have happened during seva or business or likewise,  I can now see clearly why that person had behaved the way he did. I could understand their circumstances, restlessness and helplessness. It no longer feels personal and hence I am not getting hurt by that memory. With increased clarity, suffering is not getting produced. 

Even if I get hurt, I am able to move on because clarity gives a different perspective. I don’t get stuck with the situation or person. It happened the way it did. That’s all. There could be numerous reasons why it happened. It is alright. I don’t signify things anymore. 

Forgiveness was something that was quite hard for me. Now as I am able to detach people and what they do, forgiveness is happening. I don’t need to forgive. It is all automatic. Forgiveness is spontaneous these days. Computations and calculations are absent. So is disturbance and judgement. Everything is beautiful, there is no need to complicate anything.

Connections with people have improved a lot. I used to assign nameplate to people. Now those frameworks have fallen. I can feel and connect with their suffering, even with those who have been very troublesome in my life earlier. 

I have become more sensitive to birds, animals and plants as I now know that we are all part of the same thing. I don’t know what that thing is but there is connection and compassion with everything.

Energy levels have shifted a lot on a psychological, spiritual and on physical level too. 

Inner dialogues are happening but they are not taking me anywhere. They are not distracting me. They are just there and I let them be.

Earlier I used to face with lot of conflicts. Nowadays when conflict happens, soon it is replaced by clarity.

15 years ago I was very famous for being an angry man even in Seva. Anger used to remain for days. It has significantly reduced and people around me can experience the same. 
I am a living testimony of transformation through Amma Bhagavan’s processes.

Fear is totally dead. Whatever happens the mind does take me down the path of fear. Even physical fear is quite less. Awareness and sense of a situation or danger is there. But fear is absent.

Thank you Sri Amma Bhagavan for this beautiful inner states you have gifted me with. It is invaluable to me.

         #Gopal #Patil #Goa

I have noticed a change in my father over past few weeks as I observed my inner world and outer world. He has become more calm and relaxed. While talking he crack more jokes and his tone is not loud (which indicates aggressions or anger). He barely taunts and has begin to listen and understand. He doesn't nag me, my brother and mother for small things. As there is a drastic change in my inner world, I noticed a huge change in the outer world.

How to Strengthen Your Relationship...✍🏾 Everyone’s relationship is unique, and people come together for many different reasons. But there are some things that good relationships have in common. Knowing the basic principles of healthy relationships helps keep them meaningful, fulfilling and exciting in both happy times and sad: So what makes a healthy love relationship? 1. Staying involved with each other... Some relationships get stuck in peaceful coexistence, but without truly relating to each other and working together. While it may seem stable on the surface, lack of involvement and communication increases distance. When you need to talk about something important, the connection and understanding may no longer be there. 2. Getting through conflict... Some couples talk things out quietly, while others may raise their voices and passionately disagree. The key in a strong relationship, though, is not to be fearful of conflict. You need to be safe to express things that bother you without fear of retaliation, and be able to resolve conflict without humiliation, degradation or insisting on being right. 3. Keeping outside relationships and interests alive... No one person can meet all of our needs, and expecting too much from someone can put a lot of unhealthy pressure on a relationship. Having friends and outside interests not only strengthens your social network, but brings new insights and stimulation to the relationship, too. 4. Communicating... Honest, direct communication is a key part of any relationship. When both people feel comfortable expressing their needs, fears, and desires, trust and bonds are strengthened. Nonverbal cues—body language like eye contact, leaning forward or away, or touching someone’s arm—are critical to communication.

In a powerful display of unity, both supporters and players observed a moment of silence ahead of Liverpool's match against Everton today, as a tribute to those impacted by the Israel-Palestine war. In addition to the solemn moment, players, managers, and match officials at Anfield adorned black armbands. This gesture of solidarity will be repeated at all Premier League and English Football League matches throughout the weekend. ।। ଓଁ ଶ୍ରୀ ମାତା ଦୁର୍ଗାୟୈ ନମଃ ।। ଓଁ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ଭଗବତି ପାପନାଶିନି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ସୁରରିପୁଦର୍ପଶାତନି । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ହରିହରରାଜ୍ୟଦାୟିନି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ମଖଭୁଜକାର୍ଯ୍ୟକାରିଣି ॥ ୧॥ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ତ୍ରିଦଶରିପୁକ୍ଷୟଙ୍କରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ଶତମଖପାଦପୂଜିତେ । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ମହିଷବିନାଶକାରିଣି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ହରିହରଭାସ୍କରସ୍ତୁତେ ॥ ୨॥ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେଽଷ୍ଟାଦଶବାହୁଶାଳିନି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ଶୁମ୍ଭନିଶୁମ୍ଭଘାତିନି । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ଲୋକାର୍ତ୍ତିହରେ ତ୍ରିଶୂଳିନି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ନାରାୟଣି ଚକ୍ରଧାରିଣି ॥ ୩॥ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ବାରାହି ସଦା ଧରାଧରେ ତ୍ୱାଂ ନାରସିଂହି ପ୍ରଣତା ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ବଜ୍ରଧରେ ଗଜଧ୍ୱଜେ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ କୌମାରି ମୟୂରବାହିନି ॥ ୪॥ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ପୈତାମହହଂସବାହନେ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ମାଳାବିକଟେ ସୁକେଶିନି । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ରାସଭପୃଷ୍ଠବାହିନି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ସର୍ବାର୍ତ୍ତିହରେ ଜଗନ୍ମୟେ ॥ ୫॥ ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ବିଶ୍ୱେଶ୍ୱରି ପାହି ବିଶ୍ୱଂ ନିଷୂଦୟାରୀନ୍ ଦ୍ୱିଜଦେବତାନାମ୍ । ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ସର୍ବମୟି ତ୍ରିନେତ୍ରେ ନମୋ ନମସ୍ତେ ବରଦେ ପ୍ରସୀଦ ॥ ୬॥ ବ୍ରହ୍ମାଣୀ ତ୍ୱଂ ମୃଡାନୀ ବରଶିଖି- ଗମନା ଶକ୍ତିହସ୍ତା କୁମାରୀ ବାରାହୀ ତ୍ୱଂ ସୁବକ୍ତ୍ରା ଖଗପତି- ଗମନା ବୈଷ୍ଣବୀ ତ୍ୱଂ ସଶାର୍ଙ୍ଗୀ ॥ ୭॥ ଦୁର୍ଦୃଶ୍ୟା ନାରସିଂହୀ ଘୁରଘୁରି- ତରବା ତ୍ୱଂ ତଥୈନ୍ଦ୍ରୀ ସବଜ୍ରା ତ୍ୱଂ ମାରୀ ଚର୍ମମୁଣ୍ଡା ଶବଗମନ- ରତା ଯୋଗିନୀ ଯୋଗସିଦ୍ଧା । ନମସ୍ତେ- ତ୍ରିନେତ୍ରେ ଭଗବତି ତବ ଚରଣାନୁଷିତା ଯେ ଅହରହର୍ବିନତଶିରସୋଽବନତାଃ ନହି ନହି ପରିଭବମସ୍ତ୍ୟଶୁଭଂ ଚ ସ୍ତୁତିବଳିକୁସୁମକରାଃ ସତତଂ ଯେ ॥ ୮॥ ଇତି ଶ୍ରୀ ଜଗଦମ୍ବା ସ୍ତୁତିଃ ସମାପ୍ତା । Goddess Durga symbolizes the divine forces (positive energy) known as divine shakti (feminine energy/ power) that is used against the negative forces of evil and wickedness. She protects her devotees from evil powers and safeguards them. It is believed that Goddess Durga is the combined form of powers of Goddesses Lakshmi, Kali and Saraswati. She is associated with protection, strength, motherhood, destruction and wars. Her legend centres around combating evils and demonic forces that threaten peace, prosperity and dharma; representing the power of good over evil. ଓଁ ଆଧାରରୂପେ ଚାଧେୟେ ଧୃତିରୂପେ ଧୁରନ୍ଧରେ । ଧ୍ରୁବେ ଧ୍ରୁବପଦେ ଧୀରେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୧॥ ଶିବାକାରେ ଶକ୍ତିରୂପେ ଶକ୍ତିସ୍ଥେ ଶକ୍ତିବିଗ୍ରହେ । ଶକ୍ତାଚାରପ୍ରିୟେ ଦେବି ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୨॥ ଜୟଦେ ଜଗଦାନଦେ ଜଗଦେକପ୍ରପୂଜିତେ । ଜୟ ସର୍ବଗତେ ଦୁର୍ଗେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୩॥ ସୂକ୍ଷ୍ମାତିସୂକ୍ଷ୍ମରୂପେ ଚ ପ୍ରାଣାପାନାଦିରୂପିଣି । ଭାବାଭାବସ୍ୱରୂପେ ଚ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୪॥ କାଳାଧିରୂପେ କାଳେଶେ କାଳାକାଳବିଭେଦିନି । ସର୍ବସ୍ୱରୂପେ ସର୍ବଜ୍ଞେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୫॥ ମହାବିଘ୍ନେ ମହୋତ୍ସାହେ ମହାମାୟେ ବରପ୍ରଦେ । ପ୍ରପଞ୍ଚସାରେ ସାଧ୍ୱୀଶେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୬॥ ଆଗମ୍ୟେ ଜଗତାମାଦ୍ୟେ ମାହେଶ୍ୱରି ବରାଙ୍ଗନେ । ଅଶେଷରୂପେ ରୂପସ୍ଥେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୭॥ ତୀର୍ଥଯଜ୍ଞା -ତପୋଦାନ-ଯ୍ୟୋଗସାରେ ଜଗନ୍ମୟି । ତ୍ୱମେବ ସର୍ବଂ ସର୍ବସ୍ଥେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୮॥ ଦୟାରୂପେ ଦୟାଦୃଷ୍ଟେ ଦୟାର୍ଦ୍ରେ ଦୁଃଖମୋଚନି । ସର୍ବାପତ୍ତାରିକେ ଦୁର୍ଗେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୯॥ ଆଗମ୍ୟଧାମ-ଧାମସ୍ଥେ ମହାଯୋଗୀଶ-ହୃତ୍ପୁରେ । ଅମେୟଭାବକୂଟସ୍ଥେ ଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରି ନମୋଽସ୍ତୁ ତେ ॥ ୧୦॥ ଇତି ଶ୍ରୀଜଗଦ୍ଧାତ୍ରୀସ୍ତୋତ୍ରଂ ସମ୍ପୂର୍ଣ୍ଣମ୍ । Mata Durga is the Goddess of Strength and Justice who brings compassion, peace, calm and order to the chaos, destruction and conflict in any situation. She appears to us on Her tiger, looking completely serene and composed, dressed in a red silk sari and carrying various weapons and tools in her eight to eighteen arms. In the Hindu traditions Mata Durga is the Divine Mother Goddess who presides over the seasons of life, death, and birth. To many, She is simply DEVI, which means ‘Goddess’ and comes from the sanskrit ‘Deva’, which means ‘to shine’. She is the Great Mother who helps us removing the limitations and emotional and mental obscurations that prevent us from shining the Divine Light we all carry within our hearts. Durga, which means the invincible, unconquerable and unassailable one, is the name this powerful and courageous Goddess takes after Her defeat of the buffalo-headed demon Durgama. She teaches us that the divine light of truth and wisdom will always prevail over disorder and pain. The Devi Mahatmya is a dramatic narration of the different battles the Great Goddess fights to stop all that is threatening the balance and harmony between humans and nature. Its various chapters describe how only the Great Goddess can stop the asuras (demons) that are causing so much bloodshed, violence and destruction on the earth. The demons represent the afflicted ego qualities in humans and Devi confronts the demons of arrogance, pride, hypocrisy, greed, rage, discrimination, injustice and more. ଶ୍ରୀଦଶମହାବିଦ୍ୟାକବଚମ୍ ବିନିଯୋଗଃ - ଓଁ ଅସ୍ୟ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାକବଚସ୍ୟ ଶ୍ରୀସଦାଶିବ ଋଷିଃ ଉଷ୍ଣିକ୍ ଛନ୍ଦଃ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟା ଦେବତା ସର୍ବସିଦ୍ଧିପ୍ରାପ୍ତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ପାଠେ ବିନିଯୋଗଃ ॥ ଋଷ୍ୟାଦି ନ୍ୟାସଃ - ଶ୍ରୀସଦାଶିବଋଷୟେ ନମଃ ଶିରସୀ ଉଷ୍ଣିକ୍ ଛନ୍ଦସେ ନମଃ ମୁଖେ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାଦେବତାୟୈ ନମଃ ହୃଦି ସର୍ବସିଦ୍ଧିପ୍ରାପ୍ତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ପାଠେ ବିନିଯୋଗାୟ ନମଃ ॥ ମାନସପୁଜନମ୍ - ଓଁ ଲଂ ପୃଥ୍ୱୀତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ଗନ୍ଧଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ସମର୍ପୟାମି ନମଃ । ଓଁ ହଂ ଆକାଶତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ପୁଷ୍ପଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ସମର୍ପୟାମି ନମଃ । ଓଁ ଯଂ ବାୟୁତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ଧୂପଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ଆଘ୍ରାପୟାମି ନମଃ । ଓଁ ରଂ ଅଗ୍ନିତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ଦୀପଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ଦର୍ଶୟାମି ନମଃ । ଓଁ ବଂ ଜଳତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ନୈବେଦ୍ୟଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ନିବେଦୟାମି ନମଃ । ଓଁ ସଂ ସର୍ବତତ୍ତ୍ୱାତ୍ମକଂ ତାମ୍ବୂଳଂ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାପ୍ରୀତ୍ୟର୍ଥେ ନିବେଦୟାମି ନମଃ ॥ ଅଥ ଶ୍ରୀମହାବିଦ୍ୟାକବଚମ୍ । ଓଁ ପ୍ରାଚ୍ୟାଂ ରକ୍ଷତୁ ମେ ତାରା କାମରୂପନିବାସିନୀ । ଆଗ୍ନେୟ୍ୟାଂ ଷୋଡଶୀ ପାତୁ ଯାମ୍ୟାଂ ଧୂମାବତୀ (truncated)

Despite the darkness, their vibrant drawings echo their unbroken spirits and dreams of peace. President Joe Biden said Friday that he believes Hamas's brutal attack on Israel two weeks ago was aimed at disrupting warming ties between the country and Saudi Arabia. "One of the reasons why they acted like they did ... why Hamas moved on Israel ... (was) because they knew I was about to sit down with the Saudis," Biden told guests at a campaign fundraiser. "The Saudis wanted to recognize Israel... unite the Middle East," he said. Normalization of ties between Israel and Saudi Arabia, a Middle East powerhouse, was thought to be in the offing before the October 7 mass assault on Israel by Hamas. | via Agence France-Presse

Engaging with and responding to others in our world can be challenging for all of us at times. The “rules” of appropriate social interaction are often unwritten, can change based on the setting, and usually require abstract thinking. Rules that were learned in school may not apply to the work or community setting and/or may need to be reviewed or reinforced. We have over 50 social skills resources in our Resource Library for individuals with Down syndrome (linked below). They cover topics such as conversation skills, managing conflict, tips for dealing with stress, and more. https://adscresources.advocatehealth.com/search/people-with-down-syndrome/?sort=titleasc&category=Social+Skills&utm_source=facebook&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=DS-2023&utm_term=DS21-socialskills-post&utm_content=2023-10-21:=:https://adscresources.advocatehealth.com/search/people-with-down-syndrome/

Activist group Moviment Graffitti organised a protest in solidarity with Palestine, staging a "die-in" in front of the Maltese parliament. Protesters, draped in Palestinian flags, lay on the stairs to draw attention to the ongoing conflict. They emphasised that Gaza is facing a severe humanitarian crisis due to bombings an Israeli border blockade restricting access to essentials like water, food and fuel. The group urged Europe to intervene, calling for an end to attacks on Gaza and sanctions against Israel for its occupation of Palestinian lands. They also criticised Israel's expulsion of Palestinians and implementation of apartheid-like conditions over the past 75 years. Where you at the protest?

A prayer for all those caught in conflict between Israel and Palestine. Father, we come to you now with open hearts and open minds. We ask your blessing on the work of all those committed to supporting those in conflict zones. We thank you for the courage, perseverance and resilience that they demonstrate around the world, amidst difficult and trying circumstances. In particular today we pray for peace in the Middle East: Lord Jesus, you are the Prince of Peace. We pray for an end to the violence and bloodshed, and ask you to bring a new dawn of peace across the Middle East. We pray for the leaders of the nations involved in this conflict. May you touch their hearts and their minds with your wisdom, your love and your direction. We pray for those people - men, women and children, who are caught in the midst of this war. May the love of Christ and the love of God give them a wish and a want for peace, and may they feel comfort and hope amidst the trauma. We remember all communities, effected and scattered by conflict and war. Cover them with your love, Lord, and may peace prevail. In Jesus’ Mighty Name. Amen (referenced - https://www.xavier.edu/jesuitresource/online-resources/prayer-index/prayers-in-times-of-crisis/prayes-for-peace-in-the-middle-east)

Maxene Andrews, the middle sister in the trio, the Andrews Sisters, that delighted generations of Americans with wartime swing songs such as “Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy” and “Rum and Coca-Cola,” died on this day in 1995. Andrews, who lived most of the last three decades in Los Angeles, died while vacationing in Cape Cod. The day before, she had signed autographs for fans a quarter her age at a local bagel shop, where a rare piece of Andrews Sisters sheet music--"Shoo Shoo Baby"--decorates the wood-paneled walls. With her sisters Patty and La Verne, she catapulted to the top of the pop charts in the late 1930s. They became one of the country’s most popular female recording groups, collected 19 gold records, scores of Top 10 hits and dozens of movie credits during World War II, when the Andrews Sisters were the singing sweethearts of American GIs at war bond rallies, battlefield hospitals and USO performances. Of the three sisters--none of whom knew how to read music--it was Maxene, the vivacious soprano, who reinvented her career many times over, surviving the advent of rock ‘n’ roll and continuing to perform up until her death, even after a near-fatal heart attack and quadruple bypass surgery in the mid-1980s. Andrews’ career included success as a soloist after the 1967 death of one sister, La Verne, and a falling out with Patty. But Andrews did not limit herself to performing. She spent several years as a drama instructor and top administrator at Paradise College in Lake Tahoe and enjoyed modest success as the author of a book called “Over Here, Over Here,” about the performers of the war years. Shortly after La Verne’s death from cancer in 1967, the Andrews Sisters act broke up and Maxene spent a few years in academia in Lake Tahoe, which she later told Billboard magazine was the “biggest kick I’ve ever had.” But a strange twist brought the two surviving sisters back to public attention, and a new generation of fans: the 1973 release of Bette Midler’s version of “Boogie Woogie Bugle Boy.” The following year, the Andrews Sisters, minus one, were again the rage, starring in a hit musical, “Over Here,” which ran for a year at Broadway’s Shubert Theater. It was to be the last joint performance for the two sisters, who had a falling-out that industry insiders say had to do with a conflict between Maxene and Patty’s husband, Walter Weschler, the group’s conductor and arranger. According to published reports, the sisters, despite being longtime neighbors in Encino, had only seen each other twice since 1974--once at Maxene’s bedside after her 1982 heart attack, and again at the 1987 dedication of their star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. In 1989, Maxene Andrews moved from Encino to Auburn, Calif., near Sacramento. Past 60 years of age, Maxene Andrews embarked on a solo career. She was sidelined by a heart attack at 66, but was back on stage a few months later, rehearsing strapped to a heart monitor. She showed an indomitable will, performing five weeks after heart bypass surgery. In 1990, Andrews released her only solo album, called “Maxene: An Andrews Sister.” A year later, her music was brought to life on the stage of the Kennedy Center in Washington, in a ballet choreographed by Paul Taylor and set to nine Andrews Sisters songs. Maxene's remains are interred with her sister, LaVerne, at [Forest Lawn Cemetery, Glendale, CA](https://www.facebook.com/pages/Forest-Lawn-Cemetery-Glendale-CA/216469575057692)

text: HOW WILL WE BE THE BEINGS OF THE NEW WORLD? (Read if resonates with you) All beings will have their Body of Light, since their lives will flow through it, without the mental and astral conflicts of the average man of the current time. Whoever has his Light Body active will be clear and transparent for his brothers, and will see his peers in the same way. The lies and falsehood will have ended and will be part of a gloomy past now overcome. Life in a civilization made up of human beings in their Light Bodies will be a healthy, natural, friendly and luminous life in all aspects: educational, social, political, and in the fields of science and art. Everything will be done with clear and healthy intentions of benefit for everyone, for the “being-community”, since ‘ego-ism’ will no longer exist, and the multiple spheres of separateness will have ended. The social order will be harmonious; each family will educate its own children; They will have all the time to do it in peace and with love, since materialistic ambitions will have given way to enjoying the Present, the simple, the children, the daily chores. There will also be a harmonious time for the development of the internal potentialities of beings, but all this without ever interfering with the harmony of the common Good, but, on the contrary, the development of such faculties will be placed, in due time, in function of the Common benefit. The Light Body will be the vehicle for the expression of “LIGHT”, “PEACE” and “LOVE”, concentric 'Three Suns' that will be the qualities that will flow from this Solar Vehicle towards each activity, in each relationship and towards the world. The negative, dense, “heavy” mental-astral forms that exist around the planet today will no longer exist, because after the great Planetary Purification the environment will be clean and the Men of the New Race will no longer be able to create harmful mental forms; All your thoughts will be harmonious and beneficial, of peace and brotherhood. All creations will be like crystal clear water flowing through the bed of a beautiful stream. This will be the “mental channels” of the flowing crystalline thoughts that will flow from the New Men, in that future next Race. There will be challenges..., yes; but they will be of another nature, of another category, always linked to creative development and innate internal faculties not yet explored. There will be opportunities for development in all areas of life and “the conflict of time”, which seems to be a problem of modern man, will no longer exist, because in the New Race there will be time for everything that the heart feels like doing, because everything will be harmoniously and naturally arranged for the Path that each being feels as their own, and also, because the psychological trap of 'linear time' will no longer deceive men, who in the eternity of the NOW will live in peace and harmony. Author Unknown Love and Light, Michelle Price

Resolving Conflict October 22, 2023 Twenty-Ninth Sunday in Ordinary Time (Year A) The Pharisees went off and plotted how they might entrap him in speech. They sent their disciples to him, with the Herodians, saying, “Teacher, we know that you are a truthful man and that you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. And you are not concerned with anyone’s opinion, for you do not regard a person’s status. Tell us, then, what is your opinion: Is it lawful to pay the census tax to Caesar or not?” Matthew 22:15–17 It has been said that “the enemy of my enemy is my friend.” In other words, two people who are enemies with each other will often join together if they see an opportunity to jointly attack an even greater enemy. This is what was happening in today’s Gospel. Jesus was considered the greatest enemy of the Pharisees and the Herodians, and both of these groups joined together in a plot to trap Jesus even though they greatly disliked each other. The Pharisees were very nationalistic and were strict observers of the Law of Moses. It was their view that the people should not have to pay taxes to the Romans, and many of the people agreed. The Herodians supported the Romans and, therefore, were supporters of Herod, the Jewish ruler appointed by the Roman Emperor. One of Herod’s responsibilities was to obtain taxes from the Jews for use by the Roman government. Those who opposed the paying of taxes to the Romans could even be put to death. This joint questioning of Jesus had one goal: to get Him in trouble. If Jesus said it was unlawful to pay taxes to Caesar, Herod’s soldiers could arrest Him. If Jesus said that the people should pay taxes to Caesar, the Pharisees could turn the people against Him. It appeared to be a lose-lose question posed to Jesus. Of course, Jesus’ answer was perfect. Without violating the Law of God, He also refrained from violating the civil law. Upon hearing His answer, all who heard Him “were amazed, and leaving him they went away.” The lesson learned from this passage is an especially important lesson to apply to family life. It is very common for conflicts to arise from time to time among those who are close to each other. When that happens, we can often take the approach of trying to trap the other person and trip them up with our deceptive reasoning. When this happens between two people, the conversation often turns into a shouting match with each party seeking only to find fault with the other. The solution to such situations is simple. Every conflict must be resolved by the truth. Jesus did this perfectly. He did not attack when He was attacked. He did not defend Himself irrationally. He did not shy away from the confrontation. He did not manipulate the truth to His own advantage. Instead, He spoke openly and honestly the full truth and refused to engage his opponents in their trickery. Consider this question. What if you were in Jesus’ position and the Pharisees came to you, asking you this question? What would you be tempted to answer? Most likely, you would try to answer them in such a way that appeased them. You might whisper, “We shouldn’t pay the taxes but don’t tell that to the Herodians.” And if the Herodians were to ask you that question, you might be tempted to give a different answer that appeased them. Oftentimes, when we feel as though another person is trying to trap us, condemn us, or challenge us, we become more concerned about our defense than with the honest truth. We can become afraid to say anything that will give them reason to attack us. We will be tempted to twist our answers rather than speak forthrightly with sincerity and honesty. This will never resolve a conflict. The only way to resolve anything is with the truth. Reflect, today, upon how you work to resolve conflict when it arises. Are you more like the Pharisees and Herodians whose only goal was to trick, trap and win? Do you see the other as an enemy in those moments? Or do you strive to be like Jesus who didn’t shy away from the conversation, answering honestly and directly? Of course, the truth was easy for Jesus since He was without any fault. In our lives, the truth may require that we admit our sin and apologize when confronted. However, if the truth, the full truth and nothing but the truth is our goal, then our conversations will imitate Jesus and, most often, a peaceful resolution will ensue. My truthful Lord, Your wisdom is perfect and Your words are truth. Please give me the gifts of wisdom and all truth, especially when conflicts arise. In those moments, please keep me from reacting in an angry and defensive way so that I can always be an instrument of the unity You desire. Jesus, I trust in You. #OurLadyOfLourdes #BlessedVirginMary #DevineMercy #praytherosary #Godislove #bibleverseoftheday #readings #dailyreflections #bibleverse #biblequotes #psalms #3oclockPrayer #healing #healingprayer #gospel #quotes #catholiclife #SaintsOfTheDay #catholicism #motivation (truncated)

Aforementioned surrenderee further revealed that the morale of the hierarchy of both party committee and operational command of the CTG went very low because of the mass surrender within their ranks due to the implementation of Support to Barangay Development Program (SBDP) of the National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (NTF-ELCAC). The relentless Focus Military Operation dislocated their disposition which according to her destroyed her unit which contributed much to her decision to surrender to the government forces. Sinn Féin: Palestinian Resistance? Dialogue! Mainstream political parties across Ireland have roundly condemned the actions of Palestinian resistance groups in recent weeks as they sought to rid their land of an illegal occupation. Significantly, Sinn Féin joined this chorus of condemnation, lest they offend their strategic partners in the US and elsewhere. Notably, Sinn Féin speakers who have supported this narrative have been rightly booed as a result when they took to podiums, particularly in Belfast, where at Belfast City Hall Pat Sheehan 'MLA' received such a negative reaction from the gathered masses. Much of their rhetoric has centred around demands for a two state solution, a solution which would ensure the continued Zionist presence in the region, the continued oppression of the Palestinian people and the ongoing occupation of their land. More significantly, the stance of Sinn Féin has notably changed from their past position on Palestine. Previously, clear public support for Palestinian resistance was notable among the rank and file. Now, even calls for the expulsion of the Israeli ambassador to Ireland have been deleted and removed from social media accounts of big players within Sinn Féin, most notably, Chris Hazzard 'MP'. It is abundantly clear that as pro-Palestine campaigners within Sinn Féin have set their stall out during the current crisis, there has been a major internal re-adjustment of the party's position on Palestine. Even calls from Ógra Shinn Féin, Sinn Féin’s youth wing, to expel the Israeli ambassador was too much for them. Sinn Féin’s new position is no longer 'resist the occupation' but 'dialogue'. The political equivalent of asking the abused to sit down with the abuser but where the abuser is using every means at their disposal to let the world know that it is their right to be abusive. More Palestinians have died in the past two weeks than died here in Ireland during thirty years of conflict; the extreme majority as a result of airstrikes in residential areas. Let that sink in. What is happening in Palestine now with the collective punishment of the population is a clear case of genocide and ethnic cleansing on the part of the Israeli regime. In the 1940s, the Jewish population of Europe was rounded up and placed in camps, where they were systematically exterminated and removed from the land. Jewish partisan groups became a safe haven for the persecuted. It is estimated that 30,000 of them organised and fought back against Fascism, and rightly so. If Irish Republicans at the time had called for 'dialogue' they'd have been roundly condemned by all. So remember, the next time someone breaks into your home, kills one of your children, shackles the other, and forces you to live in the shed at the end of the garden, don't fight back. Let's "talk about it" instead. We must not allow this new Sinn Féin position to become the expressed view of Irish Republicanism. Palestine has a right to resist.

PRESS RELEASE | October 20, 2023 ETHIOPIAN GOVERNMENT MUST RECOGNIZE THE TERRITORIAL RIGHTS OF ERITREAN AFAR NATION TO ACCESS THE PORT OF ASSAB In his televised address to members of the parliament of Ethiopia, the House of People’s Representatives in Addis Ababa on Oct 13th, PM Abiy argued access to the Red Sea is crucial for Ethiopia’s growth and Ethiopia’s lack of access to the Red Sea is a potential source of conflict. Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy presented the argument to Ethiopia's lawmakers that Ethiopia has an inalienable right to access the Red Sea waters, and that denial of access would be against Ethiopia's national interest. The PM also alluded to Ethiopia’s glorious past and ownership of the Port of Assab throughout history, the country is under great pressure to accommodate the fast-growing population and if the economic aspirations are unattainable, it will be a matter of time Ethiopia could be forced into another conflict over the Red Sea. As the indigenous nation of Eritrea, we would like to remind the PM of Ethiopia, Mr. Abiy, that the coastal territories, sea waters and natural resources of Dankalia, including the Port of Assab is a legal and traditional property of indigenous Afar of Eritrea. The current Eritrean regime has colonized the traditional Afar territories in the southern Red Sea coast of Eritrea using genocidal policies, violence, ethnic cleansing, uncompensated evictions and various illegal land expropriations which have resulted in the displacement of tens of thousands of Afar from their land and territories in Eritrea. In the years since Eritrea became an independent nation, the UN Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in Eritrea (COI) and other UN Special Reporters have repeatedly condemned persecution and crimes against humanity against the Eritrean Afar. UN SR May 2023 Report For Ethiopia, obtaining the Port of Assab unilaterally or making a deal with the current Eritrean leaders (PFDJ) would constitute a significant violation of international law and in violation of the sovereignty and integrity of Eritrea as well as against the aspiration of the Eritrean Afar nation to self-determination in Dankalia and political autonomy in Eritrea. Eritrea's current regime and Isaias Afwerki are responsible for much of regional instability, human rights abuses and obstacles to people-to-people relations and socioeconomic development. Organizing an effective consultation and collaborative effort between Ethiopia and the Eritrean Afar National Congress (EANC) and democratic Eritrean opposition groups is imperative in order to expedite the removal of the cancerous regime led by Isaias Afwerki in Asmara. This could lead to economic cooperation and other common interests that will benefit Ethiopians, Eritreans, and the entire Horn of Africa region. GICLO BISOH! Eritrean Afar National Congress (EANC) For further inquiries, EANC can be reached at info@dankalia.org

Confirmation of our interpretation of salt as Eros (i.e., as a feeling relationship) is found in the fact that the bitterness is the origin of the colours (feelings). Disappointment, always a shock to the feelings, is not only the mother of bitterness but the strongest incentive to a differentiation of feeling. The failure of a pet plan, the disappointing behaviour of someone one loves, can supply the impulse either for a more or less brutal outburst of affect or for a modification and adjustment of feeling, and hence for its higher development. This culminates in wisdom if feeling is supplemented by reflection and rational insight. Wisdom is never violent: where wisdom reigns there is no conflict between thinking and feeling. - CARL JUNG Food for thought....

PCRF has delivered fifty cartons of water and essential food parcels to our Dr. Musa and Suhaila Pediatric Cancer Department in Gaza. These supplies are not mere provisions; they are life-saving lifelines for our Pediatric Cancer Department. Gaza is in the throes of an unprecedented shortage of drinking water, food, and medicine, a crisis pushed to catastrophic levels due to the ongoing conflict. In this extremely dire situation, the children in our Pediatric Cancer Department, already battling cancer, face an additional challenge. The war has made it impossible for them to receive their crucial chemotherapy treatments. In the face of this extreme adversity, your support is their lifeline, a glimmer of hope amidst the overwhelming darkness they face. We extend our deepest gratitude to everyone who made this life-saving initiative possible. https://pcrf1.app.neoncrm.com/forms/gaza-relief

**APEL LA BOICOTAREA DE CĂTRE MILITARI ȘI POLIȚIȘTI, A PREZENȚEI POLITICIENILOR LA FESTIVITĂȚILE ORGANIZATE DE ZIUA ARMATEI (25 OCTOMBRIE)!** Se apropie 25 Octombrie, Ziua Armatei. Sunt vreo 60 de asociații și organizații diverse care reunesc militari și polițiști în rezervă și în retragere. Ocazia este mai mult decât perfectă pentru a exprima nemulțumirile militarilor față de clasa politică. Cum? Bineînțeles că există o multitudine de variante. Sugerez una foarte simplă, dar care va produce precis efecte. **Și anume, ca reprezentanții asociațiilor să depună coroanele omagiale înainte de sosirea *politrucilor* diverși și să părăsească locațiile pentru ceremonii, exact în momentul în care aceștia își încep discursurile în care *mint *oricum că respectă armata. Pot fi și alte variante, ideea principală fiind ca militarii și polițiștii să transmită politicienilor un semnal clar asupra faptului că politicienii au intrat în conflict cu armata! **Există și un element ajutător care va amplifica efectul și care va deveni cu siguranță util în a crea o vizibilitate maximă privind nemulțumirile militarilor, mai ales în condițiile în care doar o mică parte din asociații participă cu reprezentanți la activitățile omagiale. Elementul de efect este acela ca **asociațiile să înștiințeze în prealabil instituțiile politice ***(primării, prefecturi, partide, în București - președinția, cei 2 președinți ai camerelor, ș.a.m.d.), *cu mediatizare publică (în presă și pe rețelele de socializare), asupra faptului că militarii din asociația "X", nu vor participa alături de reprezentanții politici la ceremoniile organizate de Ziua Armatei, în semn de protest față de desconsiderarea militarilor manifestată de către clasa politică *(dovedită prin diverse acte nomative discriminatorii și cu tente vădite de persecuție politică îndreptate contra intereselor militarilor).* În cazul activităților din Mun. București, notificările trebuie să vizeze și pe reprezentanții C.C.R. și ai Î.C.C.J. și C.S.M. - și care de Ziua Armatei, de câțiva ani sunt prezenți și aceștia în tribunale oficiale - așteptând ca armata să le prezinte onorul! Nu este complicat și nu necesită mult timp! Vă dați seama ce *fețe* își vor trage cei 2 președinți ai Parlamentului sau primărița de la Craiova sau președintele C.C.R. - când vor primi înștiințări că nu sunt bineveniți printre militari la omagierea Zilei Armatei! În același timp, pot fi notificați despre ***boicot*** și marionetele din conducerile militare ale ministerelor (serviciilor). Și care oricum nu mai au nicio demnitate de mult timp, din moment ce nu au absolut nicio poziție contra loviturilor încasate de la politicieni de către militarii și polițiștii pensionați! Bineînțeles că ***sforarii*** de la asociații vor cleveti ca de obicei, cum că nu este momentul, că nu ar fi demn ș.a.m.d. Ce facem cu ei? Îi ignorăm, îi înlocuim și gata! În condițiile în care de ani de zile, acești ***sforari ***depun coroane de Ziua Armatei încolonați spășit înapoia politicienilor care lovesc în armată. Sunt aceiași ***sforari*** care după defilare, mai mânâncă fericiți și o *fasole *cu cârnați alături de politicieni și mai beau și un vin alături de aceștia. ***Așteptăm materializarea! Liderii A.N.C.M.R.R. și din cadrul M.Ap.N. și din cadrul M.A.I.! Dvs. conduceți cele mai mai asociații de militari și polițiști în rezervă/în retragere! Măcar acum în ceasul 14, fiți și Dvs. puțin demni!***
